But N. Bi. H.point to MIA. *aṅga-uñcha- (with aṅgōñcha- as lateSanskritization), poss. a MIA. form with *-vuñcha-anal. replacing puñcha- < prōñcha- (as suggested byPlatts UD s.v. and P. 1498 āsēcayati 'pours in or on' ĀśvGr̥. [Cf. ā́siñcati 'pours in' RV., Pa. āsiñcati 'sprinkles', Pk. āsitta-: √sic]
1500 āskandá m. 'attack' Kathās. ('the fourth die' TS.), āskándam absol. 'having attacked' VS. [√skand]

1508 *āstariman 'spreading out, covering'. [Cf. inf. stárimani RV., stariman- m. 'bed' lex.: √str̥]
1516 ā́sthāpayati 'causes to stay, hurts' RV., 'fixes into' AitBr. [√sthā]
1530 āsphāla m. 'striking, flapping (of elephant's ears), recoiling' Naiṣ [√sphal¹]
1531 āsphālayati 'causes to flap, rocks, shakes, throws' Hariv., 'tears asunder' BhP., āsphālana- n. 'flapping,striking' MBh. [√sphal¹]
1534 āsrava m. 'foam on boiling rice' lex., 'action of senses impelling soul to external objects'. Sarvad. [√sru]
1535 āsrāvayati 'causes to flow'. [Cf. ā́sravati 'flows off' AV., Pa. āsavati 'flows to', Pk. āsavamāṇa- 'dripping':√sru]
1545 ā́hārayati 'procures' ŚBr., 'takes for oneself, enjoys, eats' MBh. [√hr̥]

Cognateset_ID: A Comparative Dictionary of Indo-Aryan LanguagesPrevious PagePage 70 (click for page image)Next Page  	I-¹ pronominal stem: ayám, ítara-, íti, itthám, idā́nīm, iyattaká-, *iyattama-, íyant-, ihá, īdŕ̥śa-.   I² 'go': ḗti, áya-, áyana-, itá-, itvara-, itvan-;atīta-, átyēti, *adhiyēti, *adhyaya-, adhyāyá-,ádhyēti, antárēti, apāya-, apēta-, ápaiti, astamayana-, astam ēti, āya-, udayá-, *udāyayati, udita-¹,údēti, upādhyāya-, upāyana-, upētvā, úpaiti, áiti,nírēti, nyāya-, nyḕti, paraiti, paryaya-,paryāyá-, pálāyatē, palāyana-, palāyita-, pályayatē,prátīti-, pratītya, pratyaya-, prāyēṇa, prḗta-,vīta-¹, vyḕti, samayá-, sámēti, sahāya-; — *parī- ?   ikkaṭa- see itkaṭa-.
Description: A Comparative Dictionary of Indo-Aryan Languages
1550 ikṣú m. 'sugar-cane' AV., °uka- m. Suśr. [Variation in the initial syllable of i-, u-, a- and ri- suggests an orig. r̥-,but this is without other confirmation or support]
1553 iṅgita n. 'movement of body, sign, hint' Mn. [√iṅg]

1554 iṅguda m. 'the medicinal tree Terminalia catappa', n. 'its nut' MBh., °dī- f. 'the tree' MBh. Suśr., iṅgula- m.,°lī- f. lex. [Poss. connexion with hiṅgú- (hiṅgupattra- = iṅguda-) and hiṅgula- 'vermilion, name of variousplants' (in Bi. H. 'vermilion' < iṅgula-)]
1556 iccháti 'seeks for, wishes' RV. [In MIA. collides with √īps : √iṣ²]
1558 iñcāka m. 'prawn, shrimp' lex., iñcaka- KāśyapaS. [Drav. Mayrhofer EWA i 85 with lit.]

1559 iṇḍvà n. du. 'two coverings made of muñja grass to protect the hands from the fire' ŚBr. 2. iṇḍúva-.3. *induva-. [Cf. uṇḍuka- and vīṭa- with list of wordsthere given: Pa. aṇḍuva-, °uka- n. 'a roll (of cloth, hairs,or the like), aṇḍūpaka- n. 'circular roll of cloth used asa stand for a vessel']
1563 itkaṭa-, ikkaṭa- m. 'a kind of reed or grass' lex. 2. utkaṭa-¹ m. 'Saccharum sara or similar grass' Suśr.,'fragrant bark of Laurus cassia', °ṭā- f. 'the plant' lex.
1569 indīvara m. 'the blue lotus', n. 'its blossom' MBh., indivara-, indambara-, indirālaya- n. lex.
1570 indu m. 'drop (esp. of soma)' RV., 'bright drop, spark' TS., 'moon', pl. 'periodic changes of the moon'RV. [Cf. bindú- and poss. connexion with the groupunder vīṭā-]
1571 induka m. 'name of a plant (= aśmāntaka- Mn. from the fibres of which a brahman's girdle is made)' Suśr.
1573 índragōpa 'having Indra as protector' RV., m. 'cochineal insect, firefly' ŚBr. [índra-, gōpá-]
1574 indrajālá m. 'Indra's net' AV., 'jugglery, magic' Kathās. [índra-, jā́la-]
1580 *indrāgāra n. 'a well'. [S. K. Chatterji ODBL 324: índra-, agāra-]
1581 indriyá n. 'might of Indra' RV., 'virility, penis, any sense organ' AV. [índra-]
1592 ilī f. 'a kind of weapon, a cudgel or short sword', īli-, īlī- f. lex.
1594 illiśa m. 'the fish Clupea alosa', illisa- Bhpr., ilīśa- m. Udbh.
1595 iṣīˊkā f. 'reed used as an arrow' AV., 'sort of sugar-cane, small stick to stir crucible' lex., īṣīˊkā- f. 'reed, cane'MaitrS., īṣikā- f. 'arrow' lex, iśīkā- lex.
1596 iṣukā́ f. 'arrow' AV. [íṣu- f. RV., n. BHSk., Pk. isu- m.]
1600 íṣṭakā f. 'brick' VS., iṣṭikā- f. MBh., iṣṭā- f. BHSk. [Av. ištya- n. Mayrhofer EWA i 94 and 557 with lit. — Pk. has disyllabic iṭṭā- and no aspiration like mostInd. lggs.]

Cognateset_ID: A Comparative Dictionary of Indo-Aryan LanguagesPrevious PagePage 73 (click for page image)Next Page  	ĪKṢ 'see': īkṣaṇa-, īˊkṣatē, īkṣā-; ánapēkṣa-, *abhīkṣaṇa-, abhīˊkṣatē, ávēkṣatē, udīkṣā-, upaprēkṣatē,úpēkṣatē, upēkṣā-, nirīkṣatē, nirīkṣā-,parīkṣaṇa-, parīkṣatē, parīkṣā-, parīkṣin-, párēkṣatē,prátīkṣatē, pratīkṣita-, pratyávēkṣatē, prēkṣaṇa-,prēkṣaṇika-, prēkṣaṇīya-, prḗkṣatē, prēkṣā-, vīkṣa-,vīˊkṣatē; — *dēkṣati, *uddēkṣā-.
Description: A Comparative Dictionary of Indo-Aryan Languages
1612 *īdhra 'clear sky'. 2. *īdhᵃra- [īdhríya- 'belonging to the clear sky' TS.]
1614 īráyati 'causes to rise, brings to life, utters' RV. [Cf. údīrayati 'causes' RV.: √īr]
1620 īṣā́ f. 'pole of carriage or plough' RV.
1621 īṣādaṇḍa m. 'handle of a plough' VP. [īṣā́-, daṇḍá-]
1622 *īṣādhāra 'holding the pole of a plough'. [Cf. yugadhāra-: īṣā́-, dhāra-¹]
1630 úkhya 'being in a cauldron' ŚBr., 'boiled in a pot' Pāṇ. [ukhá-]

1634 ucca 'tall, lofty' Mn.; uccā́, uccáiḥ 'above' RV., uccakáiḥ Pañcat. — Forms in mod. lggs. with a nasalposs. from or influenced by údañc- 'turned upwards,upper' RV., but apparent absence of such forms inMIA. (except Pk. udaṁcida- 'raised high', see údañcati)makes this very doubtful.

1635 uccaṭati 'goes away' BhP. 2. *uccaṭyatē 'is separated from'. 3. *uccāṭya- (uccāṭayati 'drives away, scares'Pañcat., Pk. uccāḍaï 'prevents, is sorry.') [< *uccr̥tati?Cf. cr̥táti 'binds' Dhātup., ávacr̥tati 'loosens, lets go'TS.: √cr̥t?]
1643 *uccāpayati 'causes to be collected'. 2. Pass. *uccā- pyatē. [Cf. cāpayati Pāṇ., uccinōti: √ci¹]

1645 *ucciṅgaka 'a cricket'. [ucciṅgaṭa- m. 'cricket, crab' lex.; cf. ucciṭiṅga- m. 'small venomous animal in thewater, crab', cicciṭiṅga- m. 'a kind of venomous insect'Suśr., ciṅgaṭa-, °aḍa- 'shrimp' lex.]
1657 ucchēdayati 'causes to be destroyed' Pañcat. [úcchinatti 'cuts off' AV., Pa. ucchindati 'destroys', Pk.ucchiṁdaï; Pa. ucchēdana- 'destroying', Pk. ucchēyaṇa-n. 'destruction': √chid]
1665 *ujjāgrat 'awake'. [Cf. jā́garti RV. and ujjāgarayati 'awakens' Sāh., Pk. ujjāgara-, ujjāara- m. 'lack of sleep':√jāgr̥]
1671 újjvalati 'blazes up, shines' TS. 2. *ujjvālayati, újjval° 'causes to shine' ŚBr. 3. *ujjuvālayati.
1674 ujjháti 'leaves, escapes' MBh. [Formed from pp. ujjhita- < *ud-źhita- and replacing *ujjahāti, Pa.ujjahati: Mayrhofer EWA i 100 with lit.: √hā³]
1680 úñchati or uñcháti 'gleans' ŚāṅkhGr̥. [√uñch: derivation < ucci- with P. Tedesco JAOS 77, 193 ff. phonet.unacceptable].
1681 uṭa m. 'leaves or grass used for thatching' lex. [Cf. uṭaja- m. 'hut made of leaves' MBh., Pk. uḍaya- m.]
1694 uḍu f.n. 'star' Kālid. [If isolated from uḍupa- 'moon', derivation from *r̥tu-pa- (Mayrhofer EWA i 100 withlit.) is made doubtful by the Pa. form]
1695 uḍupa m. 'raft' MBh. [Cf. hōḍa- m. lex. prob. ← Drav., Tam. ōṭam]
1697 uḍḍīyatē 'flies up' MBh. 2. uḍḍayatē MBh. 3. X *uddrāti. 4. Caus. uḍḍāpayati. [For discussion ofḍ see √ḍī]

1699 uṇḍuka m. 'net, chignon, part of the body' Suśr. [Cf. uṇḍēraka- m. 'ball of flour, loaf, roll', uṇḍērakasraj- f. 'balls of meal on a string' Yājñ.: belongs to iṇḍvà- and the group of words collected under vīṭā- and isprob. ← Drav. cf. Tam. uṇṭai 'ball' Mal. uṇḍa, Kan.Tu. uṇḍe]
1704 utkaṭā f. 'the plant Laurus cassia', °ṭa- n. 'its fragrant bark' lex.
1708 utkaṇṭha 'having the neck uplifted, longing for' Kālid. 2. utkaṇṭhā- f. 'longing for' MBh. [kaṇṭhá-]
1709 utkaṇṭhati 'longs for, mourns' Dhātup. 2. utkaṇ- ṭhita- 'longing for, sorrowing for' R. [utkaṇṭha-]
1710 utkara m. 'anything dug out, rubbish' AitBr., 'heap' MBh. 2. utkāra- m. 'piling up' Pāṇ. 3. utkira-'heaping up' Kālid. 4. *utkēra- infl. by *utkērayati.[√kr̥̄¹]
1712 *utkartati 'cuts out'. [útkr̥ntati 'cuts off or out' ŚBr., Pa. ukkantati 'cuts out, skins': √kr̥t¹]
1713 utkarṣa m. 'drawing upwards, eminence' Mn., adj. 'superior, boastful' Yājñ. [√kr̥ṣ]
1716 *utkalati 'goes out or up', utkalita- 'rising, prosperous', utkalayati 'loosens' BhP. 2. *utkalyatē. 3. utkālayati'drives out' Śaṁk. [√kal²]
1723 útkirati 'digs out or up' VS., 'piles up, engraves' Kālid. 2. *utkarati prob. MIA. formation from fut.kariṣyati, &c. but cf. útkarōti 'extirpates' MaitrS.3. utkīrṇa-. 4. *utkērayati. [√kŕ̥¹]
1725 *utkucyatē 'is bent up'. [utkucati 'bends upwards, crooks, opens (as a flower)' Kauś. : √kuc]
1726 utkuṭaka 'sitting on the hams', utkaṭikā- f. 'the act of so doing' Suśr. [Cf. *utkaṭa-³ and √kuṭ¹]
1728 utkuṇa m. 'bug, louse', uṅkuṇa-, ōkaṇa-, °ṇi- m., ōkkaṇī- f., ōkōdanī- f. lex. [Cf. kuṇa-, *ḍhēṅkuṇa-,matkuṇa-¹]
1737 útkramati 'ascends' AV., 'passes away' ŚBr., 'neglects, transgresses' MBh. 2. útkrāmayati 'causes to go up'TS. [√kram]
1739 utkrāma m. 'going out or up' lex. [Cf. utkramá- m. 'id.' VS.: √kram]
1759 úttanōti 'stretches', 3 pl. aor. mid. úd atnata 'they stretched themselves' RV. [√tan]
1761 uttapatē 'gives out heat, warms oneself' Pāṇ. 2. uttapta- 'red hot' Śārṅg. 3. uttāpayati 'heats'MBh. [√tap]
1762 uttapana m. 'a partic. kind of fire' MW. [√tap]
1765 uttamá 'highest, the most removed in order or time' RV. [ud¹]
1766 *uttamaputra 'the son most removed in order'. [uttamá-, putrá-]
1767 úttara 'upper' RV., 'northern' AV., 'following, future' RV. 2. n. (sc. vākyam) 'answer' R. [ud¹]
1768 uttaraṁga n. 'wooden arch over doorframe' lex. [Perh. Pk. < uttarāṅga- n. '*upper part, last sound ofcombined consonants']
1769 uttáraṇa 'coming out, crossing over' VS., n. 'landing, crossing a river' Pañcat. 2. *uttaraṇī-. [√tr̥̄]

1770 úttarati 'elevates' RV., 'passes over' MBh., 'alights, descends' Vet. 2. uttārayati 'makes come out' MBh.,'makes descend' Pañcat. [The assumption by WackernagelAiGr 1, lii of a sanskritization of MIA. ōtarati(*ottarati) < avatarati to explain late meaning ofuttarati 'alights, descends' is perh. unnecessary:semant. development was 'crosses over — lands —alights (from boat or vehicle) — descends': √tr̥̄]
1774 uttarāpatha m. 'the north' Kathās. [uttarapatha- m. Pāṇ.: úttara-, pánthā-]
1778 uttarāṣāḍhā f. 'name of a lunar mansion' lex. [úttara-, áṣāḍhā-]
1781 uttarīˊya n. 'outer or upper garment' KātyŚrS., °aka- n. Kathās. [úttara-]
1785 uttāná 'stretched out, lying on the back' RV. [√tan]
1792 uttāraṇa n. 'act of landing, transportation, rescuing' R. [√tr̥̄]
1795 *uttutta 'pushed up'. [Sk. úttudati 'pushes up or open' AV., Pk. uttuyaï 'pains, distresses': √tud]
1797 *uttr̥ta 'passed over or up'. [Cf. uttīrṇa- 'crossed, landed, escaped', Pa. uttiṇṇa- 'drawn out', n. 'outlet':√tr̥̄]

1809 *utpaṭati 'bursts open'. 2. utpāṭayati 'roots up' SāṅkhŚr. 3. *utpaṭyati 'is burst open' (cf. utpāṭyatē'is rooted up' Suśr.) [útpaṭa- m. 'sap issuing from a cutin a tree' ŚBr., páṭati 'splits' Gr.: √paṭ¹]
1810 útpatati 'flies up, ascends' RV., 'is produced' MBh. 2. útpātayati 'causes to fly up or rise' RV. [√pat]
1813 *utpathika 'astray'. [utpatha- m. 'wrong road' Kāś., adj. 'astray' BhP., Pa. uppatha- m., Pk. uppaha- m.:pánthā-]
1815 utpala¹ n. 'blossom of the blue lotus' MBh. [Mayrhofer EWA i 103 MIA. form of útpaṭa- 'eruption'ŚBr.: very doubtful]
1816 *utpala² 'a cake', utpalī- f. 'a cake of unwinnowed corn' lex. ['shaped like a lotus'? — utpala-¹]
1819 utpāṭa 'splitting off, pulling up by the roots' lex., utpā́ṭikā- f. 'external bark of a tree' (which can besplit off?) ŚBr. [√paṭ¹]
1820 utpā́ta m. 'any sudden portent' AV., 'flying up' MBh. [√pat]

1821 utpātaka m. 'a kind of animal', utpādaka- 'a fabulous animal Śarabha' (= ūrdhvapāda-) lex., utpādikā- f. 'anoxious insect', (Wilson Hār. 110) 'flea (?), white ant',upādikā- f. (see upadīˊka-). [Poss. conn. or contam.with útpatati or útpibati 'drinks, sucks' ŚBr., utpiba- 'drinking out' Vop. — Kal. points to orig. -t-]
1823 utpāda² 'having the legs stretched out, standing on the feet' MW. [pā́da-]
1833 *utpraidha 'rising up'. [Cf. ḗdhatē 'increases' RV., 'becomes insolent' MBh., 'rises' BhP., praidhatēPāṇ. com. :√ēdh]
1834 utplavatē 'swims up' Suśr., 'springs up' Mn. 2. Caus. *utplāvayati. [Cf. 2 sg. aor. utprōṣṭhāḥ 'leapt'ĀśvŚr. :√plu]
1837 utphalati 'springs open, jumps out, bursts' Bālar. 2. utphālayati 'opens wide' MBh. [√sphal¹]
1850 *ut-śiṣṭa-. 2. úcchiṣṭa- 'left over, stale, spat out' TS., n. 'leavings' AV. [uñśiṣṭa- MaitrS. :√śiṣ]
1853 *ut-śīrṣa-, ucchīrṣaka- m. 'one who has raised his head' Suśr., n. 'pillow' Mn. [Cf. *ut-śiras-: śīrṣá-]
1857a †*ut-śrayaṇa-, ucchrayaṇa- n. 'raising, erecting' KātyŚr. (cf. ucchraya- m. 'height of tree or mountainetc.' MBh.). [√śri]
1860 *ut-śrāya-, ucchrāyīˊ- f. 'raised piece of wood', °ya- m. 'elevation, height', ucchraya- m. Yājñ. [Cf. samucchraya- m., Pa. samussaya- m. 'accumulation': √śri]
1866 *ut-śvasiti, ucchvasiti 'takes a deep breath' Gobh. 2. *ut-śvāsayati, ucchvāsayati 'causes to breatheagain, gladdens, raises' BhP. ucchvasiti
1869 útsa m. 'spring of water' RV. 2. utsíya- (utsyà-) 'coming from a spring (of water)' AV. [√ud²].
1870 utsaṅga m. 'haunch, part above the hips, lap' MBh. [√sañj]
1872 *utsadhānī 'spring of water'. [Cf. utsadhí- 'receptacle of a spring' RV. and *udadhānī-: útsa-,dhā́na-]
1873 útsanna 'raised' Suśr. 2. 'sunk, destroyed' ŚBr. [√sad. — Poss. collides with *ut-śanna- in ucchanna-- 'destroyed' Suśr.: √sad]
1874 útsarati 'hastens away, escapes' AV. 2. '*rises', cf. utsaraṇa- n. 'going up' lex., utsr̥ta- 'high' Hariv.[√sr̥]
1879 utsā́dana n. 'putting away' ŚBr., 'causing to fill up' Suśr., 'raising' lex. [√sad]
1883 útsiñcati 'causes to flow over' RV. 2. Caus. utsē- cayati. [√sic]

1886 *utsukya 'eagerness'. [Cf. utsuka- 'anxious, eager' MBh., Pa. ussuka- 'eager', NiDoc. osuǵa-, Pk. ucchua-,ussuga-, ōsua-; autsukya- n. 'longing for' MBh.,NiDoc. osukya-. Pa. uss- regularly < ut-s- contradictsthe theory of Wackernagel and Debrunner KZ 67,155 f., accepted by EWA i 9, of hypersanskritism <MIA. *icchua- (cf. Sk. Pk. icchu-). — If not conn. suvatē,sutá- 'incited' ŚBr., it may rather be sanskritization ofMIA. ussua-, ucchua- < *ut-śuka- cf. ucchōcáyant- 'inflaming' AV. (J. C. Wright). — √sū or √śuc]
1890 utsr̥ṣṭa 'let loose, abandoned' MBh. [útsr̥jati 'lets loose' RV., Pa. ussajjati: √sr̥j]
1900 *ut-sthāti 'stands up'. 2. Reformed as *utthāti. [úttiṣṭhati, udásthāt RV.; pres. -*sthāti formed after-sthā- in aor., fut., inf., and ger.: √sthā]
1901 *ut-sthāna 'act of rising'. 2. Reformed as utthā́na- n. ŚBr, 'starting on an expedition' Mn., 'manly effort'MBh. [√sthā]
1904 *ut-sthāpyatē 'is raised'. [utthāpya- 'to be raised, to be sent away' AitBr.: √sthā]
1924 údañcati 'raises, throws up' RV., 'ladles out' AV. 2. *upāñcati, úpācati 'lifts up e.g. water' ŚBr. [Phon.the mod. forms may derive from either: √añc]
1925 udáñcana n. 'bucket for drawing water from a well' RV., 'throwing up, lid' lex. [√añc]
1926 *udadhānī-, udadhāna- 'holding water' Kauś., n. 'reservoir for water' Āp. [udán-, dhā́na-]
1934 udācāra m. 'place for walking' Āp. [Cf. udā́carati 'rises out of' RV.: √car]
1936 *udāsthāti, 1 pl. aor. udā́sthāma 'we have risen again' AV., udāsthita- 'set over' lex. [√sthā]
1938 udīkṣā f. 'looking up' BhP. [údīkṣatē 'looks up at' ŚBr., Pa. udikkhati, Pk. udikkhia-: √īkṣ]
1939 údīrtē 'rises' RV. [Cf. údīrayati 'causes to move' RV., Pa. udīrēti, Pk. uīrēi 'sends': √īr]
1942 udumbára-, udú° m. 'the tree Ficus glomerata' TS., n. 'its fruit' ŚBr. 2. uḍumbára- m. AV. 3. *dumbara. 4. *ḍumbara-. [Prob. ← Austro-as. EWA i 104with lit.]
1944 údēti 'goes up, rises' RV. 2. údita-¹ 'risen' RV. 3. *udāyayati 'causes to rise'. [√i²]
1947 *udgamati 'comes forth, rises'. [Orig. subj. of aor. in udáganma 1st pl. RV.: √gam]
1948 udgamana n. 'coming forth' R., 'rising (of a star)' Pāṇ [√gam]
1953 udgalati¹ 'trickles out, oozes out, drips' BhP. 2. *udgālayati¹ 'causes to ooze out'. [~ *udgarati¹:√gal¹, √*gr̥̄¹]
1954 *udgāti 'rises, comes forth'. [Orig. subj. of aor. údagāt RV. 'has risen (of sun)': √gā]
1955 udgāthā f. 'a variety of Āryā metre' Colebrooke. [Cf. udgīthá- m. AV.: gā́thā-, √gai]
1956 *udgāmayati 'causes to rise or issue'. [Cf. udgamayati 'causes to issue' Pat., Pk. uggamiya- 'produced': √gam]
1961 údguratē 'lifts up, raises a weapon, raises the voice threateningly' VS. 2. *udgirati¹. 3. *udgurita- (replacing udgūrṇa- n. 'threatening' Yājñ.) [See *udgārayati¹, *udgr̥ta-: √gur¹]
1965 udgráhaṇa n. 'act of taking out' ŚBr., udgrabhaṇa- n. 'act of raising' KātyŚr. [√grah]
1967 udgrāhayati 'causes to take up, causes to pay' Yājñ. 2. Pp. udgrāhita-. [√grah]
1969 *udghata 'raised, opened'. [< IE *-gʷhn̊to- ? Replaced anal. by uddhata-, after úddhanti < *-gʷhen-:√han¹]
1971 *udgharati² 'lifts up'. 2. Caus. *udghārayati. 3. Pp. *udghr̥ta-. [Hardly conn. with hárati which isIE. *ĝher-]
1972 udghāṭa m. 'act of opening' Subh. 2. *udghāṭaka-¹ 'open'. 3. *udghāṭikā- 'open platform for watchingfrom', udghāṭa- m. 'watchhouse' lex. [√ghaṭ]
1973 udghāṭaka² n. 'leather bucket for drawing water' lex. [Poss. conn. with udghāṭaka- m. 'key' Mr̥cch. andudghāṭa-: √ghaṭ]
1982 *uddanta 'without teeth'. [Replaces adantáka- TS., adánt° ŚBr. (~ uddantura- 'formidable' lex., Pk.uddaṁtura- 'with projecting teeth'). — dánta-]
1986 *uddāta 'cleansed, bright, clear'. [Cf. avadāta- 'cleansed, pure, dazzling white' MBh., Pa. ōdāta-, Pk.avadāya-: √dai]
1987 uddāna¹ n. 'act of binding or fastening together' MBh. [√dā²]
1990 uddāla¹ m. 'the tree Cordia myxa or latifolia', °aka- m. Suśr. [Poss. conn. with kuddāla-²: note esp. H.uṛāl and Or. kudāḷa 'Bauhinea variegata']
1994 úddīpyatē 'blazes up' ŚBr. [Cf. úddīpayati 'inflames' AV., Pa. uddīpanā- f. 'explanation', Pk. uddīvia- 'kindled'; uddīpta- 'flaming' lex., Pk. udditta-: √dīp]
1997 *uddēkṣati 'looks for, expects'. 2. *uddēkṣā-. [Formed from *dēkṣati after údīkṣatē ŚBr.: √īkṣ and√dr̥ś]
2001 *uddrāti 'flees, flies'. [Cf. uddrāvá- 'running away' VS., m. 'going upwards' Pāṇ.: √drā]
2007 úddhanti 'lifts up' RV., 'turns up the earth' TS. [√han¹]

2009 úddharati 'takes out' RV., 'rescues, ladles up' AV., 'raises' TS. 2. úddhr̥ta- 'drawn up or out' AV. 3.uddhārayati 'raises'. 4. *ūḍhārayati < *udᶻdh- (= Av. uz-d-)? [ud-hr̥- and ud-dhr̥ collide, but Pa.absol. ūhacca is < *uhhr̥tya < ud-hr̥tya with assimilationof unexploded -d to h-: √hr̥ or √dhr̥]
2013 uddhava² m. 'name of a friend of Kr̥ṣṇa' MBh. [The ill-success of his mission to Rādhā made him asymbol of simplicity: ODBL 507]
2015 uddhāna² '*rising up', n. 'act of ejecting' lex. [Cf. újjihītē 'rises up' RV.: √hā²]
2018 uddhārá m. 'act of raising' Gaut., 'deliverance' MBh., 'loan (esp. without interest)'. [√dhr̥]
2021 uddhí m. 'seat of a carriage' AV., 'earthen stand on which the ukhā rests' ŚBr. [√dhā]
2024 *uddhuvati, or *uddhavati 'shakes up'. [Cf. dhuváti AV., dhaváti Dhātup., úddhunōti 'shakes up' RV., Pk.uddhuṇiya-, °ūṇiya- 'blown by the wind, scattered':√dhū]
2026 uddhūta, °dhuta- 'shaken, shaken off, thrown up' MBh. [Cf. úddhū˘nōti RV.: √dhū]
2027 uddhūlayati 'sprinkles with powder' Kathās. 2. uddhūlana- n. 'act of so doing' Bālar. [*dhūḍi-]
2028 uddhmāna n. 'fire-place' lex. [Perh. re-sanskritization of uddhāna-¹; but semant. cf. udvāna-³ withwhich it would collide in Paš. and Si.: √dham]
2030 *uddhrasā 'coughing up'. [dhrasnāti 'casts up', udhrasnāti 'throws up, gleans', perf. udhrasāṁ babhūva,udhrāsayati Dhātup. for uddhr° E. H. Johnston JRAS1931, 571: √dhras]
2031 uddhvaṁsatē 'is affected by disease' Car. [uddhvaṁsa- m. 'affection of the throat, hoarseness' Suśr.,uddhvaṁsayati 'attacks, affects' MBh., Pa. uddhaṁsati,Pk. uddhaṁsaï: √dhvaṁs]

2032 *uddhvalati 'goes astray'. 2. *uddhvālayati 'leads astray'. 3. *uddhvāla-. [Prob. cmpd. of hválati 'goesastray' ŚBr. = hváratē RV., hvālayati 'shakes' Bhaṭṭ.;but poss., in view of forms with ūḍh- (if < *udᶻdh-),cmpd. of *dhvalati = dhvárati 'bends, makes fall'Dhātup., 3 pl. aor. mid. ádhūrṣata RV.: √hval (√hvr̥)or √dhvr̥]
2048 udyama m. 'act of raising' Yājñ., 'undertaking, striving after, zeal' R. [√yam]
2049 *udyamati, údyacchati 'raises' RV., 'undertakes, is diligent' MBh. 2. udyamana- n. 'raising' Pāṇ.,'exertion' Daś. [√yam]
2050 *udyasati 'is eager for' [Cf. udyāsá- m. 'exertion, effort' VS., yásyati 'froths up' RV., 'heats or exertsoneself' Car., yasati Pāṇ.: √yas]
2052 udyā́na n. 'going out' AV. 2. 'park, garden' Yājñ., °aka- n. R. [√yā]
2057 udra² 'water' in anudrá- 'waterless', udrín- 'abounding in water' RV. 2. ulla-² 'wet' BHSk. [udán-: ud²]
2058 *udraṁhati 'jumps up'. 2. Caus. *udraṁhayati. [ráṁhati 'hastens' RV., raṅghatē Bhaṭṭ., láṅghati'jumps' Dhātup., all < IE. *legʷh- IEW 660: √raṁh]
2060 *udrikhati, úllikhati 'makes an incision or furrow' ŚBr., 'scratches' AśvGr̥. [√rikh¹]

2061 údricyatē 'is prominent' RV. 2. *udriñcati 'empties'. 3. údrikta- 'superfluous' TS. 4. *udrēcati 'leaves'.5. udrēcayati 'causes to increase' Rājat. 6. *udrēcyatē 'is poured out'. [All later forms have basicmeaning of uncompounded ric- 'leave, empty, pour'cf. Pa. uddēkanika- 'spouting' ZDMG 114, 445 <udrēka-: √ric]
2063 *udrīyatē 'runs out, is dissolved, is broken'. 2. *udrīṇa-. 3. *udrēpayati. [riṇā́ti 'lets go' RV.,rīˊyatē 'is dissolved, is shattered' RV., rīṇa- 'dissolved'Śiś., rēpayati Gr.: √rī]
2066 *udrēkha 'scratching, drawing', ullēkha- 'causing to appear clearly', °khā- f. 'stroke, line' lex. [√rikh¹]
2071 údvartatē 'bursts open, is puffed up with pride, originates' ŚBr., 'rises, swells' Suśr. 2. udvr̥tta-'turned up, opened' MBh. 3. údvartayati 'breaks inpieces' RV. [√vr̥t¹]
2072 udvartana n. 'pounding, rubbing and kneading the body, unguents used therefor' Yājñ. [√vr̥t¹]
2078 udvāna³, uddā° n. 'stove' lex. [Semant. cf. uddhmāna- with which it would collide in Paš. and Si.: √vā²]

2081 údvāyati 'is extinguished, is exhausted' TS. 2. údvāpayati¹ 'extinguishes' TBr. 3. udvāna-¹ n.'being extinguished' Nyāyam. [vā́yati 'is exhausted'RV., 'dries up' Dhātup., vāna-, vāta- 'dried up' lex.Merges with údvāti 'is blown out' AitBr.: √vā² and√vai]
2085 udvāhanī f. 'rope' lex., °na- n. 'anything that lifts' lex. [udvahana- n. 'lifting up' Suśr., Pk. uvvahaṇa- n.:√vah]
2091 udvēṣṭatē 'winds or twists upwards' MBh. 2. udvēṣṭana- n. 'wrapping, contraction, pain in theback' Suśr. [√vēṣṭ]
2095 undura m. 'rat, mouse' Suśr., °duru-, °daru- m. lex. 2. indūra- m. lex. [← Austro-as. EWA i 105 with lit.]

2098 unnaḍa 'arrogant' BHS ii 132, more prob. 'boisterous' Brough Dhp 279. [Perh. < *un-nr̥t-a- (Brough loc. cit.with lit.) cf. unnaṭati 'jumps' Kāś. on Pāṇ. and poss.semantic contamination with unnatá- in BHSk.'arrogant', Pk. uṇṇaya- and with unnaddha- 'impudent'MBh. — √nr̥t]
2099 unnatá 'having a large hump' VS., 'raised, high' MBh., n. 'elevated part' TS. [√nam]
2101 únnayati 'leads out or up, sets up, frees from' RV. 2. únnīta- 'led up' RV. [√nī]
2103 *unnahati 'unties'. [unnahyati 'frees, unties' Suśr., 'frees oneself, rushes out' MBh., unnahana- 'unfettered' BhP.: √nah]
2106 unnābha '*tearing open' (m. 'name of a king' Kālid.). [únnambhayati 'tears open' TS.: √nabh]
2113 *unmathyatē 'is stirred up' 2. unmathayati 'shakes, excites' BhP. 3. *unmāthayati. [unmathnāti 'disturbs, rouses' PārGr̥., mathyátē 'is stirred' RV.,māthayati MBh.: √manth]
2114 unmada 'mad, drunk' Kālid. or unmāda- 'mad' BhP., m. 'intoxication' MBh. [√mad¹]
2121 unmāna n. 'weight, value' ŚBr., 'measure of height or length' VarBr̥S. [√mā]
2137 *upakanīyas 'next younger'. [Cf. upakaniṣṭhikā- f. 'finger next the little finger' ĀśvGr̥. and kánīyas-- 'younger' RV., Pa. kaniya-, Pk. kaṇīa-, °ṇīasa-: *kana-]
2139 úpakarōti 'takes care of' ŚBr., 'provides' Mn., 'helps' R. [Cf. upaskurutē 'adorns' Pāṇ.; √kr̥¹]
2141 upakāra m. 'help, use' MBh., 'embellishment (as a gate with garlands)' Suśr. [√kr̥¹]

2144 *upakāla 'summer'. [Semant. cf. Psht. psarlai 'spring' < *upa-sarada-ka- (where sarad- is 'summer')and similar time and season names in Sk.: upaparvan- 'the day before the Parvan', upapūrvarātram 'towardsthe beginning of night': EVP 60. Did kālá-² whichgives 'year' in Sh. mean 'autumn' or 'winter'?]
2147 *upakr̥kāṭī 'part near the back of the neck'. [kr̥kā- ṭikā-]
2148 upakr̥ta 'helped' Pāṇ., n. 'help, favour' Kālid. [Cf. upaskr̥ta- 'adorned' MBh., Pa. upakkhata- 'helped':√kr̥¹]
2155 upagīti f. 'a variety of āryā metre'. [Cf. upagīthá- n. MaitrS., upagātŕ̥- m. 'one who accompanies the song ofudgātṛ' TS.: √gai]
2156 *upagr̥bhāyati, úpagr̥hṇāti 'seizes from below' AV., 'collects' TS., 'takes possession of' MBh. 2. *upaghr̥pta-. [√grah]
2157 upagraha m. 'a handful (of kuśa grass)' KātyŚr. [Cf. upagrahaṇa- n. 'act of seizing' ib.: √grah]
2158 *upaghrāyati 'smells at'. [Cf. upaghrā́yam 'smelling at' MaitrS., úpaghrāpayati 'causes to smell at' TS.upajaghrau 'kissed' Kālid. √ghrā]
2162 *upacāyayati 'heaps up'. [úpacinōti 'heaps up' TS., Pa. upacināti; Pk. uvacayaṇa- n. 'growth'; cāyayati,cāpayati Pāṇ.: √ci¹]
2165 upacít f. 'a partic. disease, a kind of swelling' VS. [√ci¹]
2166 upacīyatē 'is heaped together, is strong, succeeds' MBh. 2. upacita- 'heaped up, prosperous' MBh.,'strong, fat' Suśr. [√ci¹]
2176 *upatimyati 'wets'. [For upa with a verb 'to wet' cf. úpōnatti ŚBr., úpōtta-: √tim]
2176a †upadarśayati 'causes to appear, illudes' Kathās., 'illustrates' Yājñ., úpadadarśa- RV. [√dr̥ś]

2178 upadīˊka m., °kā- f. 'species of ant' ŚBr., upacīˊka- m. AV. (Ppp.), upajīˊka- m. AV. 2. uddēhikā- f. 'whiteant' Hār. 3. upadēhikā- f. lex. [With uddēhikā- whichis poss. ancient Bartholomae AirWb 411 compares Av.uzdaēza- m. 'piling up earth', uzdaēzay- m. 'wall'.But in addition to the preceding cf. also upajíhvikā- f.RV., upadīpikā-, uddīpikā-, upādikā-, utpādikā- f. lex.This variety of forms was attributed by WackernagelAiGr ii 1, 11 with lit., and ii 2, 316 to popular etymology.Taboo also prob. played a part. Very aberrantPk. ōliṁbhā- perh. infl. by ōliṁpaï 'smears']
2181 úpadravati 'rushes at, attacks' RV. 2. *upadrā- vayati 'causes to be attacked'. [√dru]
2191 úpapadyatē 'goes towards, attacks' AV., 'approaches for help' AitBr., 'enters' MBh., 'is produced' Kauś.,'is suitable' MBh. 2. upapanna- Yājñ. [√pad¹]
2206 úpayacchati 'lays hold of, takes' RV. or *upāyacchati cf. ā́yacchati. [√yam]
2211 *uparaṭati 'shouts to'. [úpa with 'to call' cf. úpahvayatē RV., upārudati Bhaṭṭ.: √raṭ]

2223 úpala m. 'stone, rock' MBh., °aka- m. 'precious stone' Suśr., 'upper millstone (?)' in upala-prakṣín- RV., úpalā- f. 'upper and smaller millstone' ŚBr.2. *upalla-. 3. *pala- or *palla-. [EWAi 106 l-form ofúpara-; but more general meaning 'rock, stone' suggestsanother origin. Then upalā- f. might be primarilythe smaller of the two millstones, but influencedsemant. by úpara-]
2230 *upalābhayati 'causes to obtain'. [upalabhatē 'obtains' MBh., Pk. uvalabhaï; caus. upalambhayati BhP.,Pk. uvalaṁbhaï 'obtains': √labh]
2240 upavartatē 'walks on' ĀśvŚr., 'returns' R., upā́vartatē 'approaches' RV., 'returns' MBh., upā́vartayati'causes to turn to' ŚBr. [√vr̥t¹]
2245 úpaviśati 'approaches' RV., 'sits down' ŚBr. — Pp. upaviṣṭa- 'seated' KātyŚr., °aka- 'remaining too longin the womb' Car. 2. upavēśayati 'causes to sit'AitBr. [√viś]
2247 úpavīta 'invested with the thread', n. 'the sacred thread' Kālid. [√vyē]
2251 upavēṣṭayati 'wrap up' MW., upavēṣṭitin- 'one who has wrapped a cloth round his loins' Āp. [√vēṣṭ]
2254 úpaśrayati tr. 'leans against' ŚBr., upāśrayati Mn. [Cf. upāśraya- m. 'refuge' MBh., Pa. upassaya- m.'resting place', Pk. uvassaya-, uvāsaya- m.: √śri]
2258 upasara m. 'approach' Bhaṭṭ., 'approach of a male to a female' (see *upasariyā-) Pāṇ. [√sr̥]
2260 *upasariyā, upasaryā- f. 'one to be impregnated' Pāṇ. [upasara- m. 'approach of a male to a female, covering(a cow)' Pāṇ.: √sr̥]
2261 upasḗcana 'pouring on' RV., n. 'sprinkling on' RV., 'infusion, juice' AV. [√sic]
2263 *upaskadati 'jumps towards'. 2. *upaskatta-. [Cf. inf. skádē, skádaḥ RV., aor. askadat Gr., upaskanna- 'attacked' R.: √skand]
2268 upastára m. 'anything laid under' AV. [Cf. upastír- f. 'cover' RV.: √str̥]
2269 *upastarati, úpastr̥ṇāti 'spreads over, scatters under' RV., upāstarati VarBr̥S. 2. upastáraṇa- n. 'cover'RV., 'undermattress' ĀśvGr̥. 3. *upastr̥ta- 'spreadover'. [√str̥]
2271 upástha¹ m. 'lap, sheltered or secure place' RV. [√sthā]
2281 úpaharati 'brings near, offers (food)' AV., 'takes away' MBh., °tē 'accepts' TS. [√hr̥]
2282 upahāsá m. 'sport' ŚBr., 'laughter' Kathās., upahāsya- 'to be laughed at'. [√has]
2284 upā́karōti 'fetches (úpa ā́ akaram RV.), makes preparation (for a sacred ceremonial), undertakes,begins' TS., 'consecrates' Mn. [√kr̥¹]
2287 upākṣa¹, °aka- m. 'part of cart which adjoins axletree' lex. 2. '*adjoining the shoulder'. [ákṣa-¹]
2298 *upāñjali 'putting the open hands together'. [Cf. upa-hasta- m. 'act of taking with the hand' Pāṇ.:añjalí-]
2299 upādhi¹ m. 'point of view, aim' Car., upā́hita- 'set out, proposed as prize' ŚBr. [√dhā]
2302 upānáh f. 'shoe, sandal' TS., upānaha- m. MBh. (prāṇāhitā- f. 'shoe' lex. sanskritization of MIA.*pāṇah-). [√nah]
2303 upāntá n. 'border, edge', °tḗ 'near the end' TS. [Cf. Psht. bānde 'upon' < *upā̆ntai EVP 15: ánta-]
2304 upāntika n. 'nearness', °tam 'near' R. [antika- or poss. *upānti in Pa. upanti 'near': ánti¹]
2310 upārdha n. 'half, the first half' Lalit. [Cf. upacaturaḥ 'nearly 4' Kāś.: ardhá-²]
2312 upā́labhatē 'touches' ŚBr., 'lays hold of, kills, censures' ChUp. 2. *upālābhayati. [√labh]
2323 *upēṣayati 'sends on'. [Cf. upaprḗṣyati 'drives on' AV.: prob. to be separated from úpēṣatē 'attacks' RV.< upa īṣ-: √iṣ¹]
2327 úpōdaka 'near to water' VS., n. 'the plant Basella cordifolia' Suśr. [udaká-]
2332 *upparabhūmi 'upper ground'. [Cf. uparibhūmí adv. 'above the ground' ŚBr.: *uppara-, bhūˊmi-]
2337 *ubbakka 'vomited'. [S. uḇ-, G. M. ub- point to earlier *ubb- (< *udb- ?) rather than *uvv- as in Pk.(< *udvakka- replacing udvānta-)]

2339 *ubbal 'rise, swell, boil'. 2. *ubbāl- tr. [Morgenstierne AO xviii 222 derives from ud-val-, Sk. vā̆layati, ONorwegian vella 'boil', IE. *wel- IEW 1140. If soforms of K. G.M. with b and S. with ḇ must be ← Centre,since -d-v- > Pk. -vv- and in these languages -v-.Poss., with *ubbar-, *ubbār- above, due to coalescenceof ud-val- with ud-bhar- s.v. údbharati; but cf. also asimilar series s.v. *ummaḍ-.
2341 umbara, °bura- m. 'upper timber of a door-frame' lex.
2342 *umbāḍa 'firebrand'. [Conn. doubtful with úlmuka- m. AitBr., Pk. ummua- n.]
2343 umbī f. 'fried stalks of wheat or barley', °bikā- f., ulumbā- f. lex.
2352 úrā f. 'ewe' RV. [Cf. urabhra- m. 'ram' Suśr., Pa. Pk. urabbha- m.]

2356 *urvara 'surplus, left over', urvarita- 'left over' BhP. [Poss. with EWA i 110 hyper-sanskritism fr. Pk., butperh. conn. with ulvaṇá-, ulba° 'excessive', Pk. ullaṇa-,uvvaṇa- ubba° and with urvárī- f. 'wife presented withmany others for choice' AV., Pa. ubbarī- f. 'concubine'.S. with b and ḇ indicates early MIA. -vv- and -bb-]
2357 úlapa m. 'bush, shrub, grass' RV., 'the grass Saccharum cylindricum' lex., ulū˘pa-, ulūka-² m. lex. [Cf.ulapyà- 'having to do with u°' VS., °pyá- MaitrS.]

2360 ulūˊkhala n. 'a wooden mortar' RV., aulūkhalḗ 'pestle and mortar' MaitrS. 2. *ulukkhala-. 3. udūkhala-n. Suśr. 4. *udukkhala-. [← Drav. EWA 111 withlit. Like músala-, pop. derivative with -ala- J. BlochBSOS v 742]
2362 ulkā́ f. 'meteor, fire falling from heaven' RV., 'fire-brand' ŚBr.
2375 ullasati 'shines out' BhP., 'sports' lex. 2. ullāsayati 'causes to dance' Kathās. 3. ullāsa- m. 'merriment'Kathās. 4. ullāsin- 'rejoicing'. [√las¹]
2376 ullāpayati 'coaxes' MārkP. [Cf. ullāpa- m. 'calling out in a loud voice, change of voice in grief or sickness', Pk.ullāva-, °lāya- m. 'noise, answer, change of voice':√lap]
2377 ullāla '*springing up or out' ('a sort of metre' lex.). [√lal]
2379 *ulluṇṭhati 'rolls to and fro'. [Cf. ulluṇṭhana- 'rolling' Apte, ulluṭhati 'moves violently to and fro' lex.,luṇṭhita- 'set in motion' Hariv.: √luṭh]
2382 *ullōpana 'taking out'. [Cf. úllupta- 'taken or drawn out' AV., ullōpam Kauś., Pa. ullumpati 'takes out,saves': √lup]
2384 uśīra m.n. 'fragrant root of the grass Andropogon muricatum' Suśr., °rī f. 'a species of grass' lex., ūrṣā-¹f. 'Andropogon serratum'.
2387 úṣṭra m. 'buffalo' RV., 'camel' MBh. [Cf. uṣṭŕ̥- m. 'bull drawing a plough' RV.]
2390 uṣṇa² m. 'onion' lex., °ṇā- f. 'name of a plant' Nigh. [Same as uṣṇá-¹?]
2399 usrá m. 'ray, sun, day', usŕ̥- f. 'morning light', usrā́- f. 'daybreak, cow' RV. [√vas³]

2417 ūˊbadhya or ūˊva° n. 'undigested grass &c. in the stomach of an animal killed for sacrifice' RV.2. *ubbadhya-.
2422 ūrjas n. 'vigour, strength' Sāh., ūˊrj-, °jā́- f., °já- adj. RV. [√ūrj]
2423 ūrṇanā́bhi m. 'spider' TBr., °bha- m. ŚvetUp., °bhī- f. [ūˊrṇā-, nā́bhi-]

2457 r̥dháti (a) 'increases, prospers, succeeds' RV. 2. ŕ̥dhyati Dhātup. 3. r̥ddha-. (b) '*cooks, is cooked': 1. ŕ̥dhyati.2. r̥ddha-. 3. *r̥ndhati (cf. r̥ṇáddhi 'increases' RV.)[P. Tedesco BSL 72, 114 (see ND 537 a 34) derivesthe group 'be prosperous or pleased' — Pk. rijjhaï,riddha-, &c. — from an Indo-ir. *raigh- in Sogdian rēž'pleasure'. This would however separate Pk. rijjhaï fromPa. ijjhati. 2807 *karīṣa² 'a measure of land'. [Same as kárīṣa-¹, lit. 'the amount of manure required'?]

2812 karḗṇu m. 'elephant' MBh., °ṇu- or °ṇū- f. MBh., °ṇukā- f. Pañcat. [Feminine is earlier if, with J. CharpentierIL ii 67, < *kaṇēru- (after kariṇī-) < pejorativeka- and *ṇēru- 'tusk' in Pa. rēruka- 'ivory', i.e. 'havingno or poor tusks'. But rather with EAW i 168 connectedwith kar- in karabhá-.]

2813 karōṭi f. 'cup, skull' Rājat., °ṭa- m. lex. 2. *karōṭṭi- [Prob. ← Drav. Mal. kuraṭṭa, Tu. koraṇṭu 'nut', Kan.karaṭa 'coconut shell', Tam. ciraṭṭai 'coconut shell,begging bowl' T. Burrow TPS 1945, 88]

2851 kartá¹ m. 'hole' RV. [Cf. kāṭá- m. 'hole' RV., gárta-, *gaḍḍa-¹, *gaḍḍ-¹-, gaḍa-¹, *gallī-, *gālī-,*galī-, *khaḍḍa-, *khāḍa-, khalla-², *khāla-,*khala-³. — The extensive interchange of sounds,voiced with unvoiced, retroflex with dental or l, inexplicablewithin Indo-aryan itself, in a group ofwords all indicating 'digging' and 'hole' strongly supportsassumption of Dravidian origin for it (T. BurrowBSOAS xii 370) despite the early attestation of kartá-¹,kāṭá-, gárta-¹ (EWA i 173). Beside Kan. kaḍḍa 'pitfallfor elephants' cf. Kan. gal̤de (9th cent.), gardde (11thcent.), gaddĕ 'paddy field', Brah. kaṛak 'hole']
2854 kártati¹ 'cuts' Ep. [Later pres. formation from aor. subj., fut., &c. replacing kr̥ntáti¹: with wide extensionof MIA. kaṭṭ- to distinguish from katt- 'spin' < *kartati²: √kr̥t¹]

2902 karmīˊṇa 'competent' in anuṣṭúp-karmīˊṇa- 'being performed with an a° verse' ŚBr., alaṁ-k° 'competent forany work' Pāṇ. [kárman-¹]

3014 kāñcanaka m. 'the tree Bauhinia variegata' lex. 2. kāñcanāra- m. lex.

3023 kā́ṇḍa (kāṇḍá- TS.) m.n. 'single joint of a plant' AV., 'arrow' MBh., 'cluster, heap' (in tr̥ṇa-kāṇḍa- Pāṇ.Kāś.). [Poss. connexion with gaṇḍa-² makes prob.non-Aryan origin (not with P. Tedesco Language 22,190 < kr̥ntáti). Prob. ← Drav., cf. Tam. kaṇ 'joint ofbamboo or sugarcane' EWA i 197]
3027 kātara 'confused, discouraged, cowardly' Mn. 2. *kāthala-. [Der. from katará- EWA i 197; but cf.kattara-, i.e. it may belong to a group of words meaning'weak, &c.']
3028 kānana n. 'forest' R. [With kāntāra- ← Drav. EWA i 198 with lit.]
3029 kānta¹ 'loved, charming', m. 'lover, husband', °tā- f. 'mistress, wife' R. [√kam]
3030 kāntā f. 'name of various plants, large cardamom' lex., °ta- m. 'Barringtonia acutangula'.
3031 kāntāra m.n. 'large wood, desert' MBh. [kā́ntārapathika- Pāṇ. — ← Drav. see kānana-]
3032 kāntāraka m. 'a kind of sugarcane', °ra- m. Suśr.
3037 kāpaṭa 'fraudulent' VarBr̥S. [Forms of G. < *kāpa- with -ṭa-, -la-, -ta- (or -ka-), -tra-. Cf. Sk. Pa.kapaṭa- m.n. 'fraud', Pk. kavaḍa- n.: prob. ← Drav.cf. kūṭá-¹ T. Burrow BSOAS xii 370]
3040 kā́pittha 'relating to the wood-apple tree Feronia elephantum' Pāṇ. [kapittha-]
3041 kā́pōta 'pertaining to pigeons' MBh., 'dull white, grey' VarBr̥S. [kapṓta-]
3043 kāmarūpa m. 'name of a people in West Assam' Kālid.
3046 kāmpīla¹ m. 'name of a plant' Kauś., °pilya-, °pilla- m. lex., kampīla- n. 'pigment from Rottleria tinctoria'lex., kampilya- m. lex., °aka-, °pilvaka- m. Car., °pilla-,°aka- m. Suśr.
3047 kāmpīla² n. 'name of a town' VS., kāmpilya- n., °yā- f. 'a city of the Pañcālas' MBh., °pilla- m. 'a country inthe NW of India' lex.
3048 kā́mya 'desirable' RV., °yā- f. 'name of an Apsaras' MBh. 2. *kāmiya-, cf. kāmika- 'desired' MBh.(sanskritized from kāmia- ?). [√kam]
3050 kāya² m. 'dwelling' lex. [kāyamāna- n. 'hut of straw' lex.; — same as kā́ya-¹?]
3051 kāyastha m. 'writer, man of the writer caste' Yājñ. [EWA i 200: kā́ya-¹, stha-]
3059 kāraṇḍava m. 'a kind of duck' MBh. [Cf. kāraṇḍa- m. 'id.' R., karēṭu- m. 'Numidian crane' lex.: seekaraṭa-¹]

3061 kāravēlla m. 'the gourd Momordica charantia' Suśr., n. 'its fruit' lex., °lī- f. 'the plant', °laka- m., °likā- f.Suśr., kāravallī- f. Car. 2. *kārēlla-. [S. K. Chatterji'stheory, Miscellany 74, of Drav. cmpd. 'black-spear' issupported by another name for this plant kāṇḍīra-]
3064 kā́ri m. 'artisan, worker' Pāṇ. 2. f. 'action, work' Bhaṭṭ. [√kr̥¹]
3065 kārīṣa 'produced from dung' Suśr., n. 'heap of dung' lex. [kárīṣa-¹]
3069 *kārti 'knife'. [Cf. Bal. kārč < *kārti-, Pahl. kārt < *kārti- or °ta-. For the series kr̥tí-²: *karta-³ or °ti-:*kārti- cf. Gk. καρδία: Goth. haírtō: Gk. κῆρ and Sk.hŕ̥d-: hā́rdi. — √kr̥t¹]
3076 kārmika 'engaged in action, name of a partic. Buddhist sect', n. 'any variegated texture' Yājñ.[kárman-¹]

3080 kārṣāpaṇá m.n. 'a partic. coin or weight equivalent to one karṣa'. [karṣa- m. 'a partic. weight' Suśr. (cf.OPers. karša-) and paṇa-² or āpana- EWA i 176 and 202with lit. But from early MIA. kā̆hā°]
3081 kā́rṣāpaṇika 'worth or bought for a kārṣāpaṇa' Pāṇ. [kārṣāpaṇá-]
3081a †*kārṣū- f. 'furrow, trench' ~ karṣūˊ- with dial. IA. a for ā < IE. o as in Av. karšū 'ploughed land' and inkarṣí- ~ kā́rṣi- T. Burrow BSOAS xxxviii 70,Turner BSOAS xxxvi 429.
3082 kārṣmaryà m. 'the tree Gmelina arborea' TS., kārśmarī- f. lex., kāśmarya- m., °marī- f. MBh., °mīrī-,kambhārī-, gambhārī, °rikā- f. lex. [← Drav. T. BurrowBSOAS xii 372, EWA i 202]

3083 kāla¹ 'black, dark-blue' MBh., kā́laka- Pāṇ. (kā́lakā- f. 'a kind of bird' VS.), Central Asian Sk. kāḷa- H.Lüders PhilInd 553. [< *kāḍa- ← Drav. and poss.connected with kajjala-, karṇāṭa- EWA i 203 with lit.]
3084 kālá² m. 'time' AV., 'fixed point of time' ŚBr. 'fate, death' MBh.
3089 kālapr̥ṣṭha m. 'a species of antelope' lex. [kāla-¹, pr̥ṣṭhá-]
3090 kālamukha 'black-faced' Pat., m. 'a kind of monkey' MBh. [kāla-¹, múkha-]
3092 kālalavaṇa n. 'a kind of black and factitious salt used medicinally' lex. [kāla-¹, lavaṇá-]
3093 kālasāra m. 'spotted antelope' Naiṣ. [Cf. kr̥ṣṇasāra- m. 'black antelope' Mn.: kāla-¹, sā́ra-¹]
3095 kālāṅga 'having a dark blue body (of a sword)' MBh. [kāla-¹, áṅga-¹].
3102 kālī 'the goddess Durgā' MBh., °likā- f. 'a female spirit, one of the Mothers in Skanda's retinue' MBh.[kāla-¹]

3103 kālēyaka m. 'a partic. part of the intestines' Suśr., m. 'liver' lex. [For confusion of 'heart' and 'liver' as inseveral cases below cf. HŚS s.v. kalejā to which (defined as yakr̥t-) is ascribed the function of pumpingblood through the body]

3104 kālya 'timely, seasonable' (prajanē kālyā- f. 'cow fit for the bull', see kālika-) Pāṇ., °yam, °yē 'at dawn'R. 2. kalya-³ n. 'dawn' lex., °yam 'at dawn, tomorrow'MBh., °yē BhP. [ka- < kā- with early shortening inadverb of time (similar subsequent shortenings inNIA. words below): kālá-²]
3110 kā́vya-, kāvyá- 'inspired' RV., m.pl. 'poems' MBh., n. 'inspiration, wisdom' RV., 'poem' R. [kaví-]
3112 kā́śa m. 'a grass used for mats, Saccharum spontaneum' Kauś.
3114 kā́śatē 'shines, is visible' MBh. [For meaning 'to see' cf. cā́kaśīti 'sees clearly' RV.: √kāś]
3120 kāṣṭhá n. 'piece of wood' ŚBr., °ikā- f. 'small do.' Pañcat.
3132 kā́ṣṭhā f. 'race-course' RV., 'goal, limit' ŚBr., 'cardinal point' MBh., 'measure of time = 1/30 kalā'Mn.

3136 kāsamarda m. 'remedy against cough consisting of a mixture of tamarind and mustard' lex., 'Cassiasophora' Suśr., °aka- m. lex. 2. *kāsamārja-. [Fora similar divergent ending see karamarda-: kā́sā-,marda- and mārja- ?]
3141 kāhala¹ m. 'large drum' Pañcat., °lā- f. 'a musical instrument' Rājat.
3142 kāhala² 'speaking unbecomingly or indistinctly' lex., 'downcast, faint-hearted' BHS ii 182.
3143 kiṁkara m. 'servant, slave' MBh., °rī- f. 'his wife' Pāṇ., 'female servant' MBh.
3145 kiṁnara m. 'a centaur' Mn., °rā- f. 'a musical instrument', °rī- f. 'a lute of Caṇḍālas' lex. [kím,nára-]

3149 kiṁśuka m. 'the tree Butea frondosa' MBh., kaiṁ- śuka- 'pertaining to B. frondosa' Suśr. 2. *kēśuka-.[M. Mayrhofer's assumption, EWA i 206, of a *kīsuka- 'red tree' (changed by pop. etym. to kiṁ-śuka-) ←Drav. is supported by NIA. forms which have no nasal.H. also has ṭesū m.]
3153 *kicca 'mud, dirt'. 2. *kacca-². 3. *khacca-. [Cf. Drav. words quoted s.v. *gicc- and further groupss.vv. kiṭṭa- and kaccara-¹, and *cikka-²]
3155 *kiṭana 'a tick'. [kiṭibha- m. 'bug, louse' lex., °aka- m. 'louse' Divyāv.]

3156 kiṭṭa n. 'secretion' Suśr., cf. taila-kiṭṭa- n. 'oilcake' lex. 2. *kaṭṭa-¹. 3. *katta-. 4. *khiṭṭa-. 5. kīṭa-² n. 'feces'lex., in cmpds, expresses contempt (e.g. pakṣi-k° Pañcat.)[Cf. group s.v. *kicca- and poss. ext. of 3 in *kattara-]
3160 kiṇa² m. 'insect found in wood' lex. [Poss. of same non-Aryan origin as ghuṇa- EWA i 208]
3161 kiṇihī f. 'the tree Achyranthes aspera' Suśr., kiṇi- f. lex.
3163 kínāṭa n. 'the inner part of a tree' ŚBr.
3164 kím n.sg. 'what? why?', interrogative particle RV., kiṁ vā 'or whether' Mn. [ká-²]
3166 kím u 'how much more!', kím utá RV. [kím, u¹]

3173 kirāṭa m. 'merchant' Rājat., kirīṭa-² m. BhP., kírāta- m. 'a degraded mountain tribe' VS., cilātī- f. 'woman ofthis tribe' YogH. [Alternance of k- and c-, -ṭ- and -t- suggests Drav. origin, EWA i 211. Perh. same askilāta- 'dwarf']
3174 kirātatikta-, °aka- m. 'the plant Agathotes chirayta' Suśr. 2. cirā̆tikta- m. lex.
3176 kirīṭa¹ n. 'diadem, crest' MBh., tirīṭa-¹ n. lex. [Similar alternance of k- and t- in kirīṭi- ~ tirīṭa-²]
3177 kirīṭī f. 'Andropogon aciculatus', kiriṭi- n. 'fruit of the marshy date palm (Phoenix paludosa)'. [Cf.tirīṭa-² and similar alternance of initial in kirīṭa-¹ andtirīṭa-¹]
3179 *kila 'scattering, ray'. [kīlā- f. 'flame' lex. (perh. for *kila-), -kira- in cmpd. 'scattering' Pāṇ., kiriká- 'sparkling' VS.: √kr̥̄¹]
3181 kilāṭa m. 'inspissated milk' Suśr., °ṭī- f. lex., kīlā́la- m. 'a sweet beverage (food of the gods)' AV., kīlāla-pā́- RV. [Of non-Aryan origin J. Charpentier MO xxvi 140]

3182 kilāta-, kirāta- m. 'dwarf' lex. [Perh. same as kírāta- m. 'member of a mountain tribe' VS., see kirāṭa-: cf.esp. Pa. kirāta-, °āṭa- m. 'man of a jungle tribe (classedwith dwarfs among the attendants of a chief)']
3183 kilā́sa¹ 'leprous' VS., n. 'a species of leprosy' KātyŚr.
3185 kilikilā f. 'cries expressing joy' Divyāv., kilakilā- f. MBh.

3186 kiliñca 'thin board, bamboo' lex. [Cf. kiliñja- m. 'thin plank' lex., 'mat' Suśr., °lañja- m. 'mat', kaliñja- n.'wood', m. 'mat' lex., kalañja- m. 'Calamus rotang'MW.; and further kaḍaṅkara-, °ṅgara- m. 'straw, stalks'lex., kaḍaṅkarīˊya-, °ryà- 'to be fed with straw' Pāṇ., Pa.kaḷiṅgara-, kal° m.n. 'plank, log', Pk. kaḍaṁgara- n.'shaving, chaff', kalaṅka- m. 'bamboo', kaliṁba- m. 'drywood, bamboo vessel']
3187 kilima n. 'a kind of pine' Car., m. lex.
3188 kiśara m. 'a fragrant substance for sale' Pāṇ.
3189 kiśala m.n. 'sprout' lex., °laya- n. Gaut., m. lex.: v.l. kisa°. [P. Tedesco JAOS 67, 103 °laya- < °laka-]
3190 kiśōrá m. 'foal' AV., 'a youth' BhP., °rikā- f. Pān.
3191 kiṣku m. (f. lex.) 'forearm' R., 'handle of axe' Tāṇḍya Br. [Poss. < *kr̥ṣku- EWA i 213]
3193 kīṭá¹ m. 'insect, worm' ŚBr., °aka- m. R., kīṭī- f. lex.
3196 kīdŕ̥k nom. n. sg. kīdŕ̥ś- 'of what sort?' RV. [ka-¹, √dr̥ś¹]

3202 kīla¹ m. 'stake, peg, tumour' MBh., °laka- m., °likā- f. Pañcat. 2. *kīlla-. 3. *kīḍa-. 4. khīˊla- m. 'post'AV. 5. *khīlla-. [IE. origin EWA i 216 with lit., butvariation of k- with kh-, and poss. -l- with -ḍ- supportsnon-Aryan origin proposed by J. Charpentier MO xxvi140. Cf. *khila-²?]
3203 kīla² m. 'elbow' VP., 'blow with the elbow' lex., °lā- f. 'id.' Vātsyāy. [Same as kīla-¹?]
3205 kukr̥tya n. 'evil deed' Pañcat. 2. *kukr̥tiya-. [kukr̥ta- n. Divyāv., Pk. kukkua- n. — ku-, kr̥tá-¹]
3208 kukkuṭá¹ m. 'cock' VS., °ṭī- f. 'hen' VarBr̥S., °ṭaka- m. 'wild cock' lex., kurkuṭa- m. Pañcat. [Onom., cf.kukkubha-]
3209 kukkuṭa-², kukuṭa- m. 'the potherb Marsilla quadrifolia' lex., kukkuṭī-, kukūṭī- f. 'Dolichos pruriens,Salmalia malabarica' Suśr.
3210 kukkubha m. 'the wild cock Phasianus gallus' MBh. [Cf. kukkuṭá-¹]
3211 kukkuramardaka m., °dikā- f., °dana- m. 'a plant with fragrant leaves' lex. [Platts UD s.v. kulāhal 'Celsiacoromandelina a plant dogs are fond of smelling beforeurinating'. — kukkurá-, marda-]
3216 kuca (usu. du.) m. 'female breast, teat' Suśr. 2. *kucca-. [Onom. like cuci- EWA i 219]
3217 kucika m. 'a kind of fish like an eel' lex. 2. kuñcikā-³ lex. [√kuc?]
3218 kucēla n. 'a wretched garment' Mn., 'rag' Car. [ku-, cēla-]
3222 *kujjati 'rots'. [Perh. < *kūryatē < *k°rə-ye- = kīryatē with same semantic development, or <*k°ru-ye- beside kṛṇōti 'hurts' Dhātup., Pa. karati'cuts, hurts']
3226 kuñja m. (n. lex.) 'place overgrown with plants or creepers, arbour' MBh.

3227 kuṭa¹ m.n. 'water-pot, pitcher' Yaśast., kūṭa-⁵ n. lex., kuḍikā- f. lex. 2. *kuṭava-. 3. *kōṭa-⁴. [Withkuṇḍá-¹, *kulla-³, kúlāla-, *kōḍamba-, gōla-²,*ghōla-² ← Drav. EWA i 221, 226 with lit. — Cf.kuḍava-]
3228 kuṭa², °ṭi-, °ṭha-³, °ṭhi- m. 'tree' lex., °ṭaka- m. 'a kind of tree' Kauś.
3229 kuṭaja m. 'the tree Wrightia antidysenterica (the seeds of which are used as a febrifuge)' MBh., °ṭaca- m.lex. [← Drav. (Tam. kuṭacam, Kan. koḍasige, Tel.koḍise) T. Burrow BSOAS xii 373]
3231 kuṭilá 'bent, crooked' KātyŚr., °aka- Pañcat., n. 'a partic. plant' lex. [√kuṭ¹]
3232 kuṭī f. 'hut' MBh., °ṭikā- f. Divyāv., °ṭīkā- f. Hariv. [Some cmpds. have °ṭaka)-: ← Drav. EWA i 222 withlit.: cf. kōṭa-³]
3235 kuṭumbin m. 'householder' Mn., °binī f. 'his wife', °bika- 'taking care of a household' MBh., 'slave' lex.[kuṭumba-]
3236 kuṭṭa¹ in cmpd. 'breaking, cutting', °aka- 'id.', m. 'cutter, breaker, grinder'. 2. *kōṭṭa-². [√kuṭṭ]
3240 kuṭṭanī f. 'bawd' BhP., °ṭinī- f. lex. [Poss. < '*abusive', cf. kuṭṭana- n. 'abusing', or conn. with*kuṭṭa-³, cf. B. kuṭī 'bawd']
3242 kuṭṭita 'bruised, pounded' Bhpr., °tā- f. 'unskilful opening of a vein'. [√kuṭṭ]

3243 *kuṭṭha 'knee'. [Conn. √kuṭ¹ 'bend' Grierson Tor 162 with (?). But a long range of names for joints andlimbs 'ankle-heel-foot-leg-knee-wrist' arecharacterized by the sequence of guttural -u/ō- retroflex: *kuṭṭha-, *khuṭṭa-², *khuḍa-¹, *guṭṭha-²,*gōḍḍa-, ghuṭa-, ghuṇṭa-¹]
3244 kuṭhāra m. 'axe' R., °raka- m. VarBr̥S., °rī- f. lex., °rikā- f. Suśr. [kuṭhātaṅka- m., °kā- f. lex. Prob. ←Drav. and conn. with √kuṭṭ EWA i 223 with lit.]

3245 *kuḍa¹ 'boy, son', °ḍī 'girl, daughter'. [Prob. ← Mu. (Sant. Muṇḍari koṛa 'boy', kuṛi 'girl', Ho koa, kui,Kūrkū kōn, kōnjē); or ← Drav. (Tam. kur̤a 'young',Kan. koḍa 'youth') T. Burrow BSOAS xii 373. Prob.separate from RV. kŕ̥tā- 'girl' H. W. Bailey TPS 1955,65. — Cf. kuḍáti 'acts like a child' Dhātup.]
3246 kuḍava m.n. 'a measure of grain containing a quarter of a prastha' MBh., kúṭapa- Uṇ., kuḍapa- lex. [← Drav.EWA i 224; orig. 'pot' and same as *kuṭava- ?]
3251 kuḍya n. 'wall' Yājñ., 'plastering (a wall)' lex., °yaka- n., °yā- f. 'wall' lex. 2. *kuḍiya-. 3. *kuḍa-².4. kudya- v.l.
3255 kuṇa m. 'an insect living in clothes' Gal. [Cf.utkuṇa-, matkuṇa-¹; and Psht. kōṇ, kūnai 'tick, louse'EVP 33]
3256 kuṇáti 'makes a certain noise, is in pain' Dhātup.
3257 kúṇapa n. 'corpse' AV., kuṇápa- 'smelling like a corpse' ŚBr. [← Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xii 373]
3258 kuṇāla m. 'a kind of bird' Lalit., kunāla- m. 'a Himalayan bird' lex. [Cf. kōnālaka- °nāli- (?) m. 'anaquatic bird' Suśr., konīla- m. lex., Pk. kōṇālaga- m.;and *munāla-]

3259 kuṇi 'defective in having a bent or withered arm or a hand without fingers' MBh., kūṇi- lex. [The meaningof RV. kúṇāru- as 'having a withered arm' is doubtful,but cf. Pk. kuṁṭa- ~ kuṁṭāra- s.v. *kuṇṭa-. — Seekōṇa-]

3261 kuṇṭha 'blunt, dull, stupid, lazy' MBh. [Ir. *kunda- or *kunta- 'defective' in Pers. kund, Bal. kunt 'blunt'H. W. Bailey TPS 1955, 72: cf. esp. *kunta-². Butkuṇṭha- is also one of a number of 'defective' wordslisted below characterized by the sequence 'guttural — u or ō with or without nasal-retroflex or dental stop',which lend some support to F. B. J. Kuiper's theory,PMWS 40, of Muṇḍa origin. Despite EWA i 225 andP. Tedesco JAOS 65, 97, not < kr̥ttá-]

3264 kuṇḍá¹ n. (RV. in cmpd.) 'bowl, waterpot' KātyŚr., 'basin of water, pit' MBh. (semant. cf. kumbhá-¹), °ḍaka- m.n. 'pot'Kathās., °ḍī- f. Pāṇ., °ḍikā- f. Up. 2. *gōṇḍa-. [←Drav., e.g. Tam. kuṭam, Kan. guṇḍi, EWA i 226 withother 'pot' words s.v. kuṭa-¹]

3265 kuṇḍa² m. 'son of a woman during husband's life by another man'. [P. Thieme KZ 66, 143 'pot-bastard'from kuṇḍá-¹ as gōlaka- 'widow's bastard' from gōla-²(see kumbhā-); but poss. with Pa. and Phal. wordsbelow belongs to or collides with the 'defective' groupof kuṇṭha- with kuṇḍā- f. 'mutilation' Pāṇ., kuṇḍati'mutilates' Dhātup.]
3266 kuṇḍa³ n. 'clump' e.g. darbha-kuṇḍa- Pāṇ. [← Drav. (Tam. koṇṭai 'tuft of hair', Kan. goṇḍe 'cluster', &c.)T. Burrow BSOAS xii 374]
3268 kuṇḍalá¹ n. 'ring, ear-ring' ĀśvGr̥., 'bracelet' Śiś., 'coil of a rope' lex. 2. *kōṇḍala-. 3. *guṇḍala-.4. *gundala-. [← Drav. Burrow BSOAS xii 374,EWA i 226]
3273 kutū f. 'leather oil vessel' Pāṇ., kutupa- n. 'small do.' Kāś.
3275 *kutta¹ 'dog'. [Onom.: cf. Sogd. 'kwt, Shgh. kut 'dog', Sant. kutu kutu 'sound made in calling a puppy']
3285 kudiṣṭi f. 'a partic. measure of length (longer than diṣṭi- !)' Kauś. [NIA. forms < *kudriṣṭi-. — ku-, diṣṭi-]
3286 kuddāla¹ m.n. 'a kind of spade or mattock'. 2. *kōddāla-. 3. kuḍḍāla- 'spade' Apte. [Prob.← Drav. EWA i 229 with lit.]
3287 kuddāla-², °dala-, kuṇḍala-, kudāla-, °āra- m. 'the tree Bauhinea variegata'. 2. kōvidāra- m. Gobh. [Poss.conn. with uddāla-¹]
3288 kunakhín 'having diseased nails' AV., kunakha- n. 'a disease of the nails' Suśr. [ku-, nakhá-]
3290 *kunta² 'defective'. [Cf. esp. Ir. *kunta-, see s.v. kuṇṭha- and list there given]
3291 kuntalikā f. 'a partic. kind of plant' Suśr.
3296 kunda² m. 'Jasminum multiflorum or pubescens' MBh. ('olibanum or resin of Boswellia thurifera' lex.,see kunduru-), n. 'its flower'.
3298 kunduru m. 'Boswellia thurifera and its resin' VarBr̥S., °uka- m., °ukā- f. 'olibanum' Suśr., °rūka- m.[Cf. kunda-², kandūraka-, mukunda- m. 'resin of B.thurifera']
3299 kúpyati 'is agitated' Suśr., 'is angry' MBh. [kōpáyati 'moves, shakes' RV.: √kup]
3300 kubjá 'humpbacked' VS., °aka- Pañcat. [Of non-Aryan origin EWA i 231 with lit.: see *khubja-,kubhrá-, *kubba-, *khubba-, *khundha-]

3301 *kubba 'hump'. [Poss. < *kubra-, cf. kubhrá- m. 'humpbacked bull' MaitrS.: ṛ of NIA. forms is an IA.suffix and not integral to the word as suggested byPMWS 43 and EWA i 232. Prob. belongs to the groups.v. kubjá-]

3303 kumārá m. 'boy' RV., 'prince' Ragh., °aká- m. 'little boy' RV. (*°akā- f. in Kho.), °rīˊ-, °rikā́-, f. 'young girl'AV. [Orig. 'weak, tender', cf. kumārá-dēṣṇa- opp. toskambhá-d° RV. and perh. conn. kōmalá-, cf. sukumāra- ~ sukōmala- EWA i 232, 565 with lit.]
3304 kumārī f. 'Aloe perfoliata' lex., °rikā- f. 'Capparis trifoliata' lex.
3305 kúmuda n. 'esculent white waterlily' AV. 2. kumudiká- 'pertaining to waterlilies' Pāṇ., '*waterlily'(semant. cf. nalinī- 'pond' and 'lotus').
3305a †kumudī- f. 'the plant kaṭphala- or Myrica sapida' lex., kumudikā- f. id. lex., kumudā- f. name of severalplants including kaṭphala-.
3307 kúmba m.n. 'thick end (of a bone or club)' TS.
3308 kumbhá¹ m. 'jar, pot' RV. 2. *khumbha-. [Ār. *khumbha- in Av. xumba-; semant. 'pot > pool' cf.kuṇḍá-¹, *ḍabbara-]
3309 kumbha² m.n., °bhā-, °bhī-, °bhikā- f. 'names of various plants' lex.
3313 kumbhalā f. 'the plant Sphaeranthus hirtus (the flowers of which are compared with those of Naucleacadamba)' lex.

3315 kumbhā f. 'harlot', kumbhīˊka- m. 'catamite' Suśr. [kumbhá-¹: cf. Av. xumba- 'catamite' and semant,P. N. H. G. pātar f. 'harlot' prob. ← Sk. pātra-. Ac. toP. Thieme ZDMG 91, 121 kumbhā- is hypochoristicfor kumbhadāsī- f. 'harlot': see also kuṇḍa-²]
3316 kumbhila m. 'housebreaking thief' lex. [lit. 'son of a kumbhā- ' P. Thieme ZDMG 91, 133]
3317 kumbhīra m. 'crocodile, long-nosed alligator' MBh., °īla- m. lex.
3322 kurabaka m. 'a kind of red Barleria, red amaranth' MBh., °ba- m. 'a red Barleria' lex., n. 'its blossom'Kālid., v.l. °rava-, kuruba- m. lex. [Cf. kuruṇṭa-]
3324 kurī f. 'a partic. kind of grass' lex.
3325 *kurasya 'with poor juice'. [kurasa- 'having a bad taste' W. — ku-, rasya-]
3326 kuruṇṭa m. 'yellow Barleria, yellow amaranth' lex., °ṭaka- m., °ṭikā- f. Suśr., kuraṇṭa-, °aka-, kuraṇḍaka- lex. (kuraṇṭa- m., kuruṭa- m. 'the potherb Marsileaquadrifolia'). [Cf. kurabaka-]
3327 kurula, °rala- m. 'lock of hair on the forehead' lex.
3328 kuruvinda m.n. 'ruby' Suśr., n. 'black salt, the stone cinnabar' lex.
3329 kurkurá m. 'dog' AV., kukkurá- m. Mr̥cch., °rī- f. VarBr̥S. 2. *kuṅkara-. [Onom. EWA i 237: cf.*karkuṭaka-, *kuccura-, *kutta-¹, *kukka-¹]
3330 kúla n. 'herd, troop' RV., 'race, family' Pāṇ., 'noble family' Mn., 'house' MBh.

3335 kulattha m. 'the pulse Dolichos uniflorus' MBh., °thā- f. lex., °thikā- f. Suśr. [← Drav. (Tam. koḷ 'id.',etc.), T. Burrow TPS 1945, 92 and EWA i 237, 565,with same suffix as in aśvattha-, kapittha-, dadhittha-:the same kul- in kulīnaka- ?]
3336 kuladīpa m. 'glory of a family' MW. [kúla-, dīpa-]
3338 kulaputra m. 'son of a noble family, respectable youth' MBh., °aka- m. Kathās. [kúla-, putrá-]

3340 kulā́ya n. (m. Pañcat.) 'woven texture, web, nest' AV. [Prob. with kulya- and *ghōla-² ← Drav. Tam.kuṭai, Mal. kūṭa, Kan. Tu. gūḍe, Tel. gūḍa 'basket';Tam. kūṭu, Mal. kūḍu, Kan. Tel. Tu. gūḍu 'nest'.For sense 'nest' NTS xii 265 proposes pejorative ku- +lāya- and compares Pers. kunām, Bal. kuδām 'nest'< *ku-dāman-]

3341 kúlāla m. 'potter' VS., °lī- f. Rājat. 2. kaulālá- m. 'potter' VS. ŚBr., n. 'potter's ware' ĀśrGr̥., °aka- n.Pāṇ. [→ Pers. → Par. kəlấlī 'pot': non-Aryan J. CharpentierMO xxvi 141, prob. with other 'pot' words s.v.kuṭa-¹ ← Drav. Otherwise, but less likely, EWA i 239with lit.]
3342 kulika 'of good family', m. 'kinsman' Yājñ. [kulín- 'of good family' Pāṇ.: kúla-]
3343 kuliṅga m. 'fork-tailed shrike' MBh., kuliṅkaka- m. 'sparrow' lex., kulīˊkā-, pu° f. 'a kind of bird' VS.[Prob. ← Austro-as. EWA 239, 240 with lit.]
3349 kulmāṣa m. 'half-ripe barley' ChUp., 'sour gruel of fruit juice or rice' Suśr.
3350 kulya n. 'receptacle for burnt bones of a corpse' MBh., 'winnowing basket' lex. [Prob. ← Drav.: seekulā́ya-]

3352 kulyā́ f. 'small river, canal, ditch' RV. 2. *kūlā-, kūla-² n. 'pond, tank' lex. (same as kūˊla-¹?). 3. *kūlyā-(cf. kūˊlya- 'belonging to a bank' VS.). [Variety of formsuggests poss. Drav. origin for kulyā́- as well as forkūla-² (Tam. kuḷam 'tank' T. Burrow Arch. Ling. 7,151)]
3354 *kulla³ 'pot'. [kulija- n. 'a partic. vessel' Kauś., 'a measure' Pāṇ., kulharī-, °rikā- f. 'pot' Bhpr.: prob.with kúlāla- and other 'pot' words s. v. kuṭa-¹ ← Drav.]
3356 kuváya m. 'a partic. kind of bird' MaitrS., kváyi- m. TS. (cf. also kudhi- m. 'owl' Gal. ~ kudhī- m. 'fool'Pañcat). [EWA i 283 onom.? — But poss., directly orthrough pop. etym., ku- and váyas¹]
3358 kúvala n. 'the fruit of Zizyphus jujuba' VS., kvàla- TS., kuvala- m., °lī- f. 'the tree' lex., kōla-³ n. 'the fruit'ChUp., °lā-, °lī- f., °li- m.f. 'the tree' lex.

3365 kúśala 'right, proper' AitBr., 'competent, clever' ChUp., 'healthy, prosperous' R., n. 'well-being' TUp.[P. Tedesco's (JAOS 74, 131) derivation by metath.and with Mg. ś < súkr̥ta- is ingenious but very doubtful]

3367 kuśīˊ f. 'small wooden pin used to mark in recitation' MaitrS., 'do. of metal' ŚBr., 'ploughshare' lex., °śika- m.n. lex., kuśā- f. 'pin for marking in recitation' Pāṇ.,°śikā- f. 'piece of wood used as a splint for a brokenlimb' Car.

3370 kúṣṭha¹ m.n. 'the plant Costus speciosus (used as a medicine for takmán-, a wasting disease with skineruptions)' AV. 2. *kōṭṭha-¹. 3. *kuṭha-¹, kuṭhika- m. lex. [Conn. with kúṣṭha-², either original or bypop. etym. because of its use as a specific for leprosy,is poss. EWA i 246: cf. also the oppositions in bothwords of u ~ ō, ṣṭh ~ ṭh whether after u or ō]

3371 kúṣṭha² n. 'leprosy' Suśr. 2. *kōṭṭha-² 3. kōṭha- m. 'a kind of leprosy with large round spots' Suśr.4. *kuṭha-². [Similar phonet. variation in kúṣṭha-¹:kōṭha- poss. dial. (E? Amg.? as in vēṣṭatē, Pa. vēṭhati,etc. with shortening of consonant group after longvowel) < kōṭṭha-² (also poss., but unlikely, < *kauṣṭha-, kauṣṭhika- 'of leprosy' Car.)]

3374 kuṣmāṇḍa m. 'the pumpkin-gourd Beninkasa cerifera' MBh., °ḍī-, kumbhāṇḍī- lex., kūśmāṇḍa-, kū˘ṣmāṇḍaka- Car. 2. *kōhaṇḍa-. 3. *kōhala-. [kū˘ṣm°, kūśm°, kumbh°sanskritization of MIA. kōmh° of non-Aryan origin(PMWS 144, EWA i 247). Note phonetic parallelismbetween kū˘ṣmāṇḍa- Pur. ~ kumbhāṇḍa- Buddh. 'classof demons' and kuṣmāṇḍa- (kūśm°, kūṣmāṇḍaka-) ~ Pa.kumbhaṇḍa- (Sk. kumbhāṇḍī-) 'gourd'. — kumbhaphalāf. 'Cucurbita pepo' lex. by pop. etym.]
3378 kusúmbha m. 'safflower or Carthamus tinctorius' Suśr., 'saffron or Crocus sativus' lex., °aka- m.n. 'apartic. kind of vegetable'.
3379 kusūla m. 'granary for rice or other grain' BhP., kusūla-dhānya- 'having grain stored for three years'Yājñ.

3380 kustumbarī f. 'coriander' Suśr., °buru- m. Pāṇ. 2. *kōstambarī-. [Non-Aryan: cf. tumburu- n. Suśr.,°rī- f., tubarī- f. lex. 'coriander, fruit of Diospyrosembryopteris', tumbarī- f. 'a sort of grain']
3385 kuha¹ 'cheat' in akuha- m. 'no cheat' R., kúhaka- m. 'cheat, juggler' MBh. [√kuh]
3388 *kuharayati 'coos', kuharita- n. 'cry of the kōkila bird' lex.
3391 kūṭa¹ n. 'iron mallet' MBh. [J. Bloch BSOS v 738 and T. Burrow TPS 1945, 93 connect with √kuṭṭ as← Drav.]
3392 kūṭa² m.n. 'heap, multitude' MBh. [Prob. ← Drav. T. Burrow TPS 1945, 94; but for poss. conn. withkūṭa-¹ cf. ghaná-¹ 'club' ~ ghaná-² 'compact, dense']
3393 kūṭa³ n. 'part of a plough, its share' lex. [kuṭaka- n. 'plough without a pole' lex. ← Drav. T. Burrow TPS1945, 93 and EWA i 251]

3395 kūṭa⁶, °aka- 'base (of coins)' Yājñ., 'false, untrue' Mn. [Perh. same as kūṭá-⁷ 'hornless' AV., Pa. kūṭa- (← Drav.? EWA i 251) and so conn. *kuṭṭa-³, *khōṭi-,*khōṭṭa-. Similar range of meaning in other 'defective'groups, e.g. laṭṭa-¹]

3399 kūḍayati, kūḷ° RV. 'burns', akūlayat AitBr., kūlita- 'burnt' Suśr., kúṇḍatē 'burns' Dhātup. [If of non-Aryanorigin, poss. conn. with Pa. kōḷāpa- 'dry (of a tree)']
3400 kūˊpa¹ m. 'hole, hollow, cave' RV., 'pit, well', °aka- m. lex.

3401 kūpa², °aka- m. 'mooring post, mast' lex. [← Drav. (Tam. kūmpu 'mast, cone-shaped pinnacle of chariot',Mal. kūmpu 'mast, pointed heap', Tu. kū˘vè 'mast')T. Burrow BSOAS xi 135, xii 375. Prob. therefore tobe separated from kūˊpa-¹: nevertheless for semanticdevelopment, 'pit ~ heap ~ post' see kūˊpya-,*khaḍa-², khātra-, mēthí-, skambhá- and esp.kūpaka- 'funeral pyre, hole under it' lex.]
3402 kūpa³, °aka- m. 'leather oil vessel' lex. 2. *kumpa-². 3. *kuppa-. [Any connexion with kutū-, kutupa- doubtful]

3408 kūrcá m. 'bunch, bundle of grass' TS., °aka- m. 'toothbrush, painter's brush' Suśr., °ikā- f. 'brushmade of hair' lex., kūcīˊ- f. 'paintbrush, pencil' Suśr.[Perh. with T. Burrow BSOAS xii 375 belongs to samegroup of lws. fr. Drav. as guccha-]
3412 kūˊrdati 'leaps, jumps' MBh. [gūˊrdati, khūˊrdatē Dhātup.: prob. ← Drav. (Tam. kuti, Kan. gudi 'tospring') T. Burrow BSOAS xii 375]
3413 kūrpara m. 'elbow' Suśr., 'knee' lex., °rā- f. 'elbow' lex., kaurpara- 'being at the elbow' Suśr. [Seekaphōni-]
3415 *kūrma² 'roof'. 2. *kaurma-. [Poss. same as kūrmá-¹, kaurma- 'appertaining to a tortoise, *like atortoise shell'?]
3416 kūˊla¹ n. 'declivity' RV., 'shore' ŚBr., 'heap, mound' Car., °aka- m.n. 'bank, shore' lex. [Same as kūla-²?]
3418 kr̥kalāsá m. 'chameleon' TS., °aka- m. MBh. MIA. and NIA. attest various forms: 1. *kr̥kkalāsa-.2. *kr̥kkala-. 3. *kr̥kaṇṭaka-.

3419 kr̥kāṭikā f. 'joint of neck' Suśr., kŕ̥kāṭa- n. AV., °ṭaka- n. lex., kakā́ṭikā- f. 'a part of the skull' AV.[PMWS 29 groups -kāṭ-, prefixed by kr̥-, ka-, withkaṇṭhá- as Mu., and so separates from kr̥ka- 'throat,neck']
3420 kr̥cchrá 'painful, miserable' MBh., n. 'difficulty, trouble, danger' RV. [Derivation from *kr̥psrá- Wackernagel AiGr i 158 and EWA i 257 with lit. issupported by WPah. u < r̥ before p. — √kr̥p]
3428 kr̥tyá 'proper to be done' MBh., kr̥tyā́- f. 'action' AV. [√kr̥¹]

3440 kr̥muká m. 'a kind of tree' ŚBr., kramu- m. 'betelnut tree' lex., °ka- m. 'id.' Suśr., 'mulberry, Symplocosracemosa, Cyperus' lex., kēmbuka- n. 'kernel of arecanut' lex., krumuká- m. 'a piece of wood used to catchthe sacrificial fire when kindled by friction' TS.
3440a kr̥muká-. 3. †*kr̥mbuka-: WPah.kṭg. cimmu- m. 'mulberry' (← a language in which kr > c Him.I52), J. kimu m. Perhaps also forms under 2 and 3 inCDIAL.
3449 kr̥ṣṭá 'drawn, ploughed', n. 'ploughed land' ŚBr. [Doubtful whether there is identity or connexion with√*kaḍḍh which largely replaced √kr̥ṣ]
3451 kr̥ṣṇá 'dark blue, black' RV., kŕ̥ṣṇaka- 'blackish' Pāṇ. 2. Nom. prop. esp. of the incarnation of Viṣṇu.

3456 kr̥sará-, kr̥ś° m. 'a dish of sesamum and grain, rice and peas and spices' Kauś., kr̥sara- n. MBh., °rā- f.Suśr. [Cf. *khēsārī- ?]

3457 kēkara 'squinting, cross-eyed' Mn. (iii 159 as v.l.), °aka- Cāṇ., kēdara- lex. [Connexion with other wordsfor 'crooked, squinting' suggested by EWA i 264, inrejecting IE. origin with Lat. caecus etc., is doubtful.But if kēkara- is deriv. of *kēka- < IE. *kaiko IEW 519,there is a parallel formation in *ḍēvva- ~ ḍēvvara- andthe same semantic range 'one-eyed — blind — squinting'in *śrēḍa-. — See ṭēraka-, ṭagara-¹, *ḍēra-¹,*ḍhēra-², *trēḍḍa-, *trēḍḍha-]
3462 kētaka m. 'the tree Pandanus odoratissimus' MBh., °kĭ̄- f. Gīt. [← Drav. EWA i 264 with lit.: also cf.Savara keda. In S. it collides with kadala- of Austroas.origin.]
3464 kēndu m. 'a kind of ebony, Diospyros embryopteris', °uka- m. 'D. glutinosa (yielding a sort of tar)' lex. [Cf.tinduka-, tumbara-]
3465 kēmuka m. 'Costus speciosus' lex., 'Colocasia antiquorum' Bhpr. [Cf. kēvuka- m. Car., kēcuka- m.Suśr., kacu- m., kacvī- f. lex., kēlūṭa- m. Npr., also 'akind of potherb' Car.: ← Drav. EWA i 266]
3466 kēyūra m.n. 'bracelet on the upper arm' MBh. [← Drav. (cf. esp. Mal. kayyuṟa 'glove') T. BurrowBSOAS xii 375, EWA i 266]
3469 kēvárta m. 'fisherman' VS., kaivarta- m. Mn., °aka- m. R. 2. *kēvāṭa-.
3471 kḗśa m. 'hair of the head' AV. (RV. in cmpd.).
3472 kēśāgra n. 'the tip of a hair' ŚāṅkhGr̥. [kḗśa-, ágra-]
3473 kḗśya 'being in the hair, suitable for the hair' AV. [kḗśa-]
3474 kḗsara n. 'hair (of brow)' VS., 'hair' ŚBr., 'mane, filament of lotus and other plants' R., 'fibre (of mango)'Suśr.
3477 kaitava n. 'stake in gambling' MBh., 'deceit' R., °aka- n. 'gambling' MBh. [kitavá- m. 'gambler' RV.,Pa. kitava- m.]
3481 kṓka m. 'wolf' R., kōkaḍa- m. 'fox' lex. [Perh. in kṓkayātu- m. RV. (EWA i 268 with lit.) and in AV. 'a kindof noxious parasitical animal', cf. same double meaningin N. baũso < vr̥kadaṁśa-]
3483 kōkilá¹ m. 'the Indian cuckoo Cuculus indicus', °lā- f. MBh. [Among NIA. forms those of S. Or. Mth.Bhoj. Aw. G. apparently, unless borrowed, are < -illa-:all others, except M., may be < -illa-]
3484 kōkila² m. 'lighted coal, charcoal' lex. [PMWS 47 sanskritized from MIA. kōila- ← Proto-muṇḍa *koyila= Sant. kuilạ 'black': all NIA. forms must or mayrest on *kōilla-]
3485 kōkilākṣa-, °aka- m. 'plant with a dark, black-centred flower, Capparis spinosa or Asteracanthalongifolia or Barleria l.' lex. [Cf. kōkilanayana- m.'id.'. — kōkila-¹, ákṣi-]
3487 kōṅkaṇa m. 'name of a people on the western shore of the Deccan' MBh., °aka- m. Hariv.
3493 kōṭa³ m. 'hut, shed' lex. [← Drav. T. Burrow TPS 1945, 95: cf. kuṭī-]

3496 kōṭará n. 'hollow of a tree' MBh., 'cave, cavity' BhP. [← Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xii 376: supported byvariety of initial (k-, kh-) and medial consonants (-ṭ-,-ṭṭ-, -l-) in NIA.]
3497 kṓṭi¹ 'curved end of bow, edge, point of sword' MBh. [√kuṭ¹]
3498 kōṭi² f. '10,000,000' Mn. [Separate from kṓṭi-¹: ← Austro-as. EWA i 270 with lit.]
3501 kōṭṭapāla m. 'commander of a fort' Pañcat. [kōṭṭa-¹, pāla-]

3503 *kōḍi 'a score, twenty'. [J. Przyluski RoczOrj iv 231 ← Austro-as. (Mahle kuri, Birhar kuṛi, Kharia kori,Juang koḍi: prob. same as word for 'man', i.e. '20fingers') whence → Drav. (Kurukh kūrī, Malto koṛi,Kui kōḍe)]
3504 kōṇa m. 'corner, angle' MBh. [Cf. kuṇi-, *khuṇṭa-²: ← Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xi 341]

3520 *kōpyatē 'is made angry'. [Pass. of kōpáyati 'shakes' RV., 'makes angry' MBh. — √kup]

3530 *kōrati 'scrapes', kōrita- 'scraped out of the ground' Bhpr., 'pounded' W. [√*kur]

3539 kṓśa m. 'bucket' RV., 'case, cover' AV., 'sheath' MBh., 'storeroom' Mn., 'seed-vessel' R., 'inner partof breadfruit' lex., °aka- m. MārkP. [Cf. *khōsa-]
3540 kōśakāra¹ m. 'maker of scabbards or boxes' R., kōśakārīˊ- f. VS., 'silkworm' KapS., °raka- m. Yājñ.[kṓśa-, kāra-¹]
3541 kōśakāra² m.n. 'a kind of sugarcane' Suśr. [kōśakr̥t- m. Suśr. — Same as kōśakāra-¹?]
3543 kōśāmra m. 'Mangifera sylvatica', n. 'its fruit' Suśr., 'a fruit = raktāmra- ' lex. [kṓśa-, āmrá-]
3545 kṓṣṭha¹ m. 'any one of the large viscera' MBh. [Same as kṓṣṭha-²? Cf. *kōttha-]

3558 kauṭumba 'necessary for a household' ĀśvGr̥., n. 'household' Rājat. [kuṭumba-]
3559 kauṭumbika 'pertaining to the family', m. 'father of a family' BhP. [kuṭumba-]
3565 kaula 'relating to a family' R., 'of noble family' lex. [kúla-]
3569 kausumbhá 'prepared with safflower', m. 'wild safflower' lex., n. 'safflower prepared as a potherb'VarP., °aka- 'dyed with safflower' AgP. [kusúmbha-]
3576 *krapyati 'howls', or with expressive doubling *krappati. [kŕ̥patē, aor. akrapiṣṭa 'howls, weeps' RV.,krápatē 'sympathizes with' Dhātup. — √kr̥p]

(krīˊḷati, °ḷā́-, °ḷí- f., °ḷú-), is ofnon-Aryan origin (see in last instance A. MasterBSOAS xii 363 and F. B. J. Kuiper Festschr. A.Debrunner 242: EWA i 279 with earlier lit.), thenthese forms may stem from the same source. Ifkrīˊḍati is IE., it has crossed with these, e.g. Pk. kiḍḍaï,killaï ~ kīḍaï. Sk. kḗlati 'trembles' Dhātup., kḗli- f. 'amorous play' Mn., khḗlati 'shakes' R., khēlāyáti'plays' Bhaṭṭ., khēli- f. 'sport' Gīt. may be connected.kṣvḗlati 'jumps, sports' R., kṣvēli-, °ikā- f. 'play' BhP.ac. to EAW i 296 is sanskritization of khēl-; but,although there is no form in NIA. with c̣h-, or ch-, Gy.eur. and arm. kh-, pal. k- (not x- and ḳ- < Sk. kh-) attestkṣv)-. H. helnā 'to play', if < *abhikhēl-, separateskhēl- from kṣvēl- or represents a late cmpd. with MIA.kh- < kṣv)-]

4740 cāṇḍālá m. 'man of lowest and most despised caste' VS., °lī- f., caṇḍāla- m. ŚāṅkhGr̥.
4741 cāturthaka 'appearing every 4th day' Suśr. 2. cāturthika- 'belonging to the 4th day' TāṇḍyBr., m.'quartan fever' W. [caturthá-]
4742 cāturmāsyá n. pl. 'name of three sacrifices at the beginning of the 4-month period' TS., n. 'beginning ofa season of 4-months' MBh. [caturmāsa-]
4743 cāttra-, cat° n. 'spindle' PārGr̥., 'peg used with the araṇi in making fire by friction' KātyŚr. com.

4749 *cāmala or *cāvala- 'husked rice'. [S. K. Chatterji ZII ix 31 < *cāma-, √cam with little probability: Pk.and several NIA. lggs. have no trace of nasal. Poss. ofultimately same non-Aryan origin as taṇḍulá-]
4751 cāmuṇḍā f. 'a form of the goddess Durgā' MārkP. [Cf. carmamuṇḍā-, caṇḍam° f. lex.]
4752a †cā́yati 'observes' TS., imperf. ácāyat TS., 1 sg. aor. ácāyiṣam AV. [√cāy, cf. √ci²]
4753 cāyayati 'causes to be heaped up' Pāṇ. 2. cāpayati Pāṇ. [√ci¹]
4754 cāra¹ m. '*one who moves about', 'spy' MBh., °aka- m. MBh. [~ cāla-¹. — √car]
4758a †cāraṇa-² 'belonging to the same Vedic school' Gaut., m. 'wandering actor or singer' Mn.[cáraṇa-]
4760 cāráyati 'causes to move, shakes' AV. 2. 'grazes' tr. AV. [~ cāláyati-. — √car]
4769 cāla² m. 'movement' in danta-cāla- m. 'looseness of teeth' Suśr. [~ cāra-². — √cal]
4771 cālana n. 'causing to move' MBh., 'causing to pass through a strainer' W., 'strainer, sieve' lex., cālanī- f.lex. [~ cāraṇa-, *cāraṇī-. — √cal]
4773 cā́ṣa¹ m. 'the blue jay (Coracias indica)' RV. [Also 'snipe' in L. P. and aberrant forms with ṭh- and t- in M.]

4775 *cāh 'see, look for, desire'. [J. Bloch Festschr. Wackernagel 147 'deformed' from abnormal and unattestedMIA. *cākh- < cakṣatē to avoid clash with*cakṣati 'tastes' (cf. *pracāh- ~ pracakṣatē)? Or< *cāgh- see √*cagh- ? Uncertain]
4776 cikura¹ m. 'hair of head' Gīt., 'hair of a chowry' Bālar., cikūra- lex., cihura- lex.
4779 cikka¹ m. 'muskrat' lex., cikkā- f. 'mouse' lex. [Cf. cikura-³ m. 'muskrat' lex., cikkira- m. 'a kind of mouse'Suśr.]
4780 cikka² 'gummy matter in eyes, bird-lime' BHS ii 229. [Cf. cikkáṇa-, cikhalla- (and further forms thereshown), *kicca-: ← Drav. (DED 2053), ← Mu.(Kuiper) EWA i 385, 386.]

4781 *cikka³ 'small'. [Cf. cikva- m. 'young elephant', cikkagaja- m.; cikṣa- 'young', *ciṅga-: perh. same ascikká-⁴, cikiná- 'flat-nosed' Pāṇ., cikina- 'flattened,stumpy' Harṣac. — ← Drav. (cf. Kan. cikka 'small')LM 330, T. Burrow BSOAS 12, 379]
4784 cikhalla m. 'mud, mire'. 2. *cakhalla-. 3. *cikkhalla-. [Cf. ciṅkhala- 'muddy' Buddh., cikila- m.'mud' W., icikila- m. 'pond, mud' lex.: see cikka-²]
4786 ciṅgaṭa m., °ṭī- f., °aḍa- m. 'shrimp' lex. 2. *ciṅ- gaṭṭa-. [Cf. ucciṅgaṭa- m. 'cricket, crab' lex. (see*ucciṅgaka-), *jhiṅga-, karkaṭa-¹, gāṅgaṭa-]

4791 cicciká m. 'a kind of bird' RV. [Onom. cf. *cicc-]

4792 ciñcā f. 'the tree Tamarindus indica', °cikā- f. Bhpr. 2. ciñciṇī- f. ŚārṅgP. 3. cintiḍī- f. lex. [Cf. caṇḍa-²'tamarind', cuñcurī-, °ulī- f. 'game played with tamarindseeds' lex., *tintiṇī- and other forms s.v. tintiḍī-:← Mu. PMWS 135 with some forms through Drav. T.Burrow BSOAS xii 379]
4795 *ciṇoṭṭhī 'Abrus precatorius'. [Cf. ciñcī- f., kākaciñcā- f.; Pk. deśīn. kaṇeḍḍhiā- f.]
4798 cíti f. 'layer, pile, stack of wood' TS. [√ci¹]
4805 citrakara m. 'painter' MBh. [Cf. citrakāra- from which it cannot in all cases be distinguished. — citrá-,kará-¹]
4811 citraśālā f. 'room ornamented with pictures' R. [citrá-, śā́lā-]
4814 cinṓti 'heaps up' AV. (páricinutē 'collects' RV.), 'collects' MBh., 'gathers up' MuṇḍUp. 2. *cinvati. [√ci¹]
4817 cintāmaṇi m. 'fabulous gem which gives possessor all his desires' Hariv. [cintā́-, maṇí-¹]
4818 cipiṭá 'flat, flatnosed' Pāṇ., cipiṭaka- m. 'flattened rice' lex. 2. *cippiṭa-. 3. *cimpaṭa- 4. *cippiṭṭa-.[Cf. carpaṭa-, capēṭa-, *capp-]
4820 cibuka n. 'chin' Yājñ., cubuka- n. BhP., cibu- n., cibi- m. lex. 2. chúbuka- n. RV. [← Mu. PMWS 155,EWA i 389, 395]
4825 *cirātana 'lasting a long time'. [Cf. ciratna-, cirantana- 'ancient' Pāṇ. and purātana-. — cirá-]
4826 cirbhaṭa m. 'Cucumis utilissimus' Car., °ṭī-, °ṭikā- f. Pañcat., carbhaṭa- m. lex. 2. cirbhiṭa- m., °ṭā- f. lex.3. *jibbhuṭa-. [Of Mu. origin PMWS 144]
4828 cillaṭa-, °aḍa- m. 'a creeping animal' Car., cillakā- f. 'cricket' lex.
4829 cilli m. 'a kind of bird of prey' Suśr., cillā- f. 'kite' Mālavik., °la- m. Buddh., gaṅgā-cilli- m. 'the blackheadedgull Larus ridibundus'. [Cf. *illi-]
4831 *civant or *cīvant- 'how great?'. [Cf. Av. cvant-, and ā́ kīˊvataḥ 'how far?' RV. ~ kíyant-. — ka-¹]
4832 *ciṣṭa 'message'. [Cf. Av. kaēš-, činasti 'teaches, makes known', Pahl. nām-čišt 'known by name'H. W. Bailey JRAS 1934, 510]
