10143 mīˊlati intr. 'closes (of eyes)' BhP., mīlayati tr. 'closes (eyes, flowers)' BhP. [sáṁ mīˊlya 'with closed eyes'RV. — √mīl]
10144 mukuṭa m.n. 'tiara, crest, point, head' MBh., makuṭa- Divyāv. [← Drav., Tam. mukaṭu 'top' &c.,DED 4002; mauli- m.f. 'diadem, etc.' MBh. is MIA.(cf. EWA ii 694)]

10146 mukula n. 'bud' Suśr., makula-² n. lex. 2. mukura-, makura-² n. lex. 3. *bakula-². [Cf. similar interchangeof initial in bakula-¹. — ← Drav., Tam.mokkuḷ &c., DED 4007; also mudgara-² m. 'bud' lex.with same variation of -k- ~ -dg- as in mukuṣṭha-]

10147 mukulayati '*blossoms'. 2. *mukurayati. 3. mukulāyatē. [mukulayati (tr.), °lāyatē (intr.) 'closes(like a bud)' Kāv., °litá- R., °lāyita- Kāv. 'havingblossoms', mukurita- 'id.?' Pāṇ.gaṇa. — mukula-]

10148 mukuṣṭha-, °aka- m. 'a kind of bean' lex., mukuṣṭa- m. BHSk., makuṣṭa-, °aka- m. 'Phaseolus aconitifolius',mapaṣṭa-, °aka- m. 'a kind of bean, mapuṣṭhaka-, mayu° m. lex. 2. *makusta-. [mudgaṣṭha- m. lex. (with same variation of -k- ~ -dg- as inmukula-) cf. mudgá- and *maṭṭha-³]
10150 *mukka¹ 'blow with fist'. [Prob. ← Drav., Prj. muṭka 'blow with fist', Kur. muṭkā 'fist', DED. 4041]
10152 muktā f. 'pearl' Mn. [Sanskritization of MIA. muttā- (Lüders PhilInd 179 < *mūrtā-: mūrtá-; butrather, with mutya- n. lex., ← Drav., Tam. muttu,muruntu &c., DED 4062)]
10153 muktājāla n. 'an ornament of pearls' MBh. [muktā-, jā́la-]
10153a †*muktāsarikā- f. 'string of pearls'. [Cf. muktāsraj- f. lex., mauktikasara- m. Nalac. both ← MIA.? — muktā, *sarā-²]
10161 mukhacandra m. 'moon-like circle of face' Bhartr̥. [múkha-, candrá-]
10170 mukhāgra n. 'extremity of a snout or nose, any extremity' lex. [múkha-, ágra-]
10174 múkhya 'pertaining to face or mouth' AV., 'chief' TS. [múkha-]
10177 mucalinda-, mucilinda- m. 'the tree Pterospermum suberifolium' lex., muculinda- m. R., nicula- m.'Barringtonia acutangula' R., nicōla- m. Car. 2.mucukunda- m. 'P. suberifolium' lex.
10184 múñja m. 'the grass Saccharum sara or munja' ŚBr., muñjaka- m. VarBr̥S., muñjā- in cmpd. MBh.

10186 muṭáti '*twists' ('kills, grinds' Dhātup.) 2. mṓṭati (v.ll. mṓḍati, múṇṭati, múṇḍati) Dhātup., mōṭayati'kills' Mr̥cch., gala-mōṭana- n. 'strangling' Śukas.,aṅguli-mōṭana- n. 'snapping of fingers' lex.3. *mōṭyatē 'is twisted'. 4. *muruṭati, *murōṭati. [Cf.mūˊta- m.n. 'woven basket' TBr., mū˘ṭa-, mōṭa-¹,mūtōḍī (Pa. mū˘tōḷī-, v.l. mū˘ṭōlī- with which compare*murōṭati above) 'basket, bundle' BHSk. ← Drav.(Tam. muṭai 'to plait, braid' DED 4036, mūṭai 'bundle'DED 4134 prob. unconnected with muṭai). Partly (cf.galamōṭana-) collides with muṭáti 'ākṣēpē, pramardanē'Dhātup.← Drav. (Tam. muṭṭu 'to dash against' DED4041) and poss. infl. by √mr̥d (see múṇṭati). Cf. also*mōṭa-² 'wicker stool' (J. C. W.). — √muṭ]

10187 *muṭṭa¹ 'defective'. 2. *muṭṭha-¹. 3. *muṭṭhara-. 4. *muḍa-. 5. *muḍḍa-. 6. *muḍḍha-¹ (cf. mūḍhá-).7. *muṇṭa-. 8. *muṇṭara-. 9. *muṇḍha-.10. *muṇḍhara-. 11. *mōṭṭa-¹. 12. *mōṭṭha-.13. *mōṭṭhara-. 14. *mōḍḍa-. 15. *mōṇḍa-. [A 'defective' word-group to which also muṇḍa-¹ belongs. — Cf. *mutta-: see list s.v. *maṭṭa-. — Cf. *muḍḍha-²,*muṇḍa-² 'lump']

10191 muṇḍa¹ 'shaved, bald, lopped' MBh., 'hornless' VarBr̥S., 'blunt' Kathās., m. = °aka- m. 'trunk oflopped tree' lex. [Prob. of Drav. origin (A. MasterBSOAS xii 354) with coalescence of two Drav. wordgroups(DED 4199, 4200); less likely Mu. connexions(J. Przyluski BSL xxx 199, PMWS 102). Not withP. Thieme ZDMG 93, 134 < *mr̥ṁṣṭa- nor withP. Tedesco JAOS 65, 82 < vr̥ddha-² 'cut'. In IA. itforms part of 'defective' word-group s.v. *muṭṭa-¹with all variations characteristic of such groups. — Cf.*muṇḍa-² 'lump']

10196 *mutta 'defective'. 2. *muttha-¹. 3. *mutthara-¹. 4. *munda-. 5. *munna- (cf. mauna- n. 'silence'MBh.). 6. *mōtthara-¹. 7. *mōdda-¹. 8. *mōddha- (cf. mudhā?) [Cf. *mitta-, *matthara-,*muṭṭa-¹: see list s.v. *maṭṭa-. — Cf. *muttha-²,*mutthara-². *mōtthara-², *mōdda-² 'lump' and*mūna-, *mōnna- 'silent' s.v. mauná-]
10197 *muttha² 'lump'. 2. *mutthara-². 3. *mōtthara-². 4. *mōdda-². [See list s.v. *maṭṭha-². — Cf. sameseries of 'defective' words s.v. *mutta-]
10198 mudgá m. 'the bean Phaseolus mungo' VS. [Cf. mudgaṣṭha-, °ṣṭa- m. 'kind of bean' lex. (~ mukuṣṭha- and mudgara-² ~ mukula-)]
10203 mudrā́ f. 'seal, signet-ring' MBh. [Prob. ← Ir. EWA ii 654]
10205 mudhā 'in vain, to no purpose' MBh. [Scarcely with P. Tedesco JAOS 73, 83 MIA. form of vŕ̥thā. Cf.*mōddha- 'defective' s.v. *mutta- ?]

10206 *munāti¹ 'knows', muṇáti 'pratijñānē (perceives, recognizes?)' Dhātup. [Cf. Pa. Dhātumālā √mun'ñāṇē'; fut. mōnissaṁ; Vimānavatthu com. munana- n. = paricchindana-; RV. múni- m. 'inspired sage',Br̥ĀrUp. 'viditvā munir bhavati'. (J. C. W.). — PischelGrPk 345 connects with √mīv 'push, impel' see*munāti²]
10207 *munāti² 'drives'. [Cf. āmīvati 'pushes, presses, TBr., nimīˊvantī- f. pres. part. 'pressing down' AV.,prámīvati 'pushes on, instigates' ŚBr. TS., kā́mamūta- 'impelled by love' RV. — √mīv]
10209 muraṅgī-, °ruṅgī- f. 'Moringa pterygosperma'. [← Drav., Tam. muruṅkai etc., DED 4085]
10210 muraja m. 'tambourine' MBh., °jā- f. 'large drum' lex. [← Drav., Tam. muracam etc., DED 4076. — Cf.muralī-]
10211 *murati¹ 'crushes, rubs'. 2. *mulati. [Cf. perf. subj. mumurat RV., pass. mūryátē ŚBr., múr- m. 'destroyer'RV. — √mr̥̄]
10213 murala m. 'a kind of fresh water fish' Suśr.
10214 muralī f. 'flute, pipe' lex. [← Drav., Tam. muraḷi &c., DED 4076. — Cf. muraja-]
10215 *murumura 'crackling'. [Onom. — Cf. múrmura- m. 'expiring ember' MaitrS., 'burning chaff' Kāv.,Pa. mummura- m. 'hot ashes, burning chaff']
10216 muṣ in cmpds. 'stealing' MBh., f. 'theft' MW. [muṣīván- m. 'thief' RV. — √muṣ]
10221a †muṣṭigraha- m. 'holding with one hand' Harav. [muṣṭí-, gráha-]

10223 músala m.n. 'pestle' AV., 'club' Mn., musra- n. lex. 2. *muṣala- or *muśala-. [s after u and in NIA.variation of ū with u point to non-Aryan origin (J.Bloch BSOS v 741 ← Drav.: see also maṣati)]
10224 musalī f. 'the plants Curculigo orchioides and Salvinia cucullata' lex.
10226 musta m.n., °tā- f., °taka- m.n. 'the fragrant grass Cyperus rotundus' Suśr., bhadra-musta- m. R̥tus.2. *mōsta-.

10231 mūˊka-, mūká- 'dumb' VS., ŚBr. 2. *mūga-. 3. *mukka-². 4. *mukkara-. 5. *mugga-.6. *muṅga- (cf. *guṅga-). 7. *mōkka-. 8. *mōgga-.[A defective word-group poss. developed, with variationssimilar to those of other such groups, from mūˊka- which is in any case at least partly onom. (cf. *mūna-,*mōnna- 'silent' s.v. mauná-). — See list s.v. *maṭṭa-]

10232 mūḍhá 'stupified' AV., 'stupid' Mn., 'gone astray' R. [mūḍhá- ~ mugdhá- is Indo-ir. (cf. Khot.mūysaṁdai 'foolish' with -ys- < IE. -ĝh- H. W. BaileyTPS 1960, 78, EWA ii 662), but was poss. associatedwith or gave rise to 'defective' word *muḍḍha-¹ in thegroup *muṭṭa-. — √muh]

10233 mūta m.n. 'basket' TBr., '*bundle', mūtaká- n. 'little basket' ŚBr., mūtōḍī- f. BHSk. 2. mūṭa-,muṭa- m.n. 'basket, bundle' Kāraṇḍ. 3. *muṭṭa-³.4. *mūṭha-. 5. *muṭṭha-². 6. mōṭa-¹ m. 'bundle'Divyāv. 7. *mōṭṭa-². 8. *mōṭha-¹. [← Drav. cf.Tam. muṭi 'knot, tuft, bundle' &c. DED 4030, Tam.muṭai 'to plait, braid' &c. (see muṭáti), and Tam.mūṭai, mūṭṭai 'sack, bundle' &c. DED 4134. — Formng. 'capital sum &c.' see also *mūḍa- s.v. mūˊla-]
10241 mūrchayati 'coagulates (milk)' Kauś., 'makes in a solid shape' AitBr., 'strengthens, excites' MBh.[√mūrch]
10245 mūˊrti f. 'any solid body' Up., 'figure' MBh., 'image, idol' Kāv. [√mūrch]
10247 mūrdhán m. 'cranium, head, top, chief, beginning' RV.

[Despite early occurrenceand proposed connexion with Gk. μω̑λυ (IEW750), variation of -l/r- ~ -ḍ- supports non-Aryan, perh.Drav., origin: cf. Tam. muḷā, muḷḷaṅki 'radish' &c.,DED 4105. Prob. only chance resemblance with L. andBi. forms of MIA. muḍḍha- < mūrdhán- with meaningof 'root']
10252 *mūlanārāyaṇa 'name of a local deity (?)'. [Cf. mūˊradēva- m. 'a class of demons' RV., nārāyaṇá-]

10254 mūˊlā f., mūˊla- m. '17th or 19th lunar mansion' AV.
10258 mūṣa m., °ṣā- f. 'rat, mouse' Pañcat., mūṣaka- m. Yājñ., muṣ° lex. 2. mūˊṣika- m. 'rat, mouse' Gaut.[mūˊṣ-]
10264 mr̥gá m. 'wild animal, deer' RV. 2. mr̥gī- f. 'doe' R. 3. *mr̥gā-.
10266 mr̥gatr̥ṣṇi f. 'mirage' BhP., °ṇikā- f. R. [See márīci- Add. — mr̥gá-, tŕ̥ṣṇā-]
10276 mr̥ṇā́ti 'crushes' AV., mr̥ṇáti RV., 'threshes' ŚBr. 2. Pp. mūrṇá-¹ AV. 3. *mr̥ṇṇa-. [*mr̥ṇṇa- frompres. stem (or < *mr̥dna-, cf. mr̥ditá- 'pressed down,squeezed' AV.: √mr̥d). — √mr̥̄]
10277 mŕ̥ṇāla n.m. 'edible lotus root' MBh., mr̥ṇālī- f.'lotus' MBh., °lin- m. lex., °linī- f. Kālid., nom. sg.mulālīˊ m. or f. 'id.?' AV.
10278 mr̥tá 'dead' RV., n. 'death' MBh., °aka- n. KātyŚr.com. [Pp. of mriyátē and máratē. — √mr̥]
10280 mr̥tamātr̥ka 'one whose mother is dead' Kathās. [mr̥tá-, mātŕ̥-]

10282 *mr̥tāpatya 'whose offspring are dead'. [Cf. mr̥taprajā- f. Mn. — mr̥tá-, ápatya-]
10286 mŕ̥ttikā f. 'earth, clay' VS. [*mr̥tti- in Pk. and some cmpds. — mŕ̥d-]
10294 mr̥ddhá 'forsaken' MaitrS. [márdhati 'neglects' RV. 'wets' Dhātup. (< '*softens'?) — The words ofL. P., if derived from this, support an orig. meaning'crush' for √mr̥dh: see EWA ii 595]

10298 mŕ̥ṣā 'in vain' RV., 'falsely' AV., miṣa- n. 'false appearance' Kāv. [√mr̥ṣ?]
10299 mr̥ṣṭá¹ 'rubbed, washed, pure' RV., 'prepared, savoury' R., 'sweet, pleasant' MBh., miṣṭa-¹ 'dainty,sweet' MBh. [√mr̥j or √mr̥ś]
10301 mḗkhalā f. 'girdle' AV., 'band, fillet' lex. [Similar ending in śr̥ṅkhala-]

10309 mēḍhraśr̥ṅgī f. 'the plant Odina pinnata' lex. [mēḍhra-², śŕ̥ṅga-]

10310 mēṇḍha² m. 'ram', °aka-, mēṇḍa-⁴, miṇḍha-², °aka-, mēṭha-², mēṇḍhra-, mēḍhra-², °aka- m. lex. 2. *mēṇṭha-(mēṭha- m. lex.). 3. *mējjha-. [r- forms (which arenot attested in NIA.) are due to further sanskritizationof a loan-word prob. of Austro-as. origin (EWA ii 682with lit.) and perh. related to the group s.v. bhēḍra-]

10496 *yuṭati 'is joined'. 2. *yuṭyati. 3. *yuṭṭa-. 4. *yōṭayati (yaúṭati, yaúḍati 'joins' Dhātup.).5. *yōṭa- (yōṭaka- m. 'constellation' lex.). [juṭati, juḍati'binds' Dhātup. are MIA. (S. with j- attests earliery-). Relationship with √yu¹ or √yuj is obscure.Direct derivation (P. Tedesco OrLit 1932 col. 530) of*juḍa- < yuta- or *juṭṭa- < yuktá- is phonet.difficult. Poss. the series started with MIA. *yuṭṭa- which replaced yutta- and from which *yuṭati, *yōṭayati,&c. were analogically created (cf. truṭyati).Forms in H. M. with -ḷ- and -l- (< earlier -ḍ- or -l-)suggest non-Aryan origin or influence, or may bedue to collision with yugala-. — √*yuṭ]

10538 *rakka 'defective'. 2. *rakkara-. 3. raṅká- 'slow, dull' Uṇ., 'poor, hungry' Prab., m. 'starveling'Mālatīm., °aka- m. Bharaṭ. (~ *laṅka-¹). 4. *raṅkha-.5. *raṅga-⁴. (~ vēllant-), vā̆layati '*causesto turn' (cf. valayita-), 'causes to move, causes to becovered' Dhātup. 3. vállatē '*turns', 'covers' (válatē,vállatē 'saṁcaraṇē, saṁvaraṇē, str̥tau') Dhātup. 11500 vātālī f. 'whirlwind' Kathās., vātāvalī- f. Ratnāv. [J. Bloch in C. Kunhan Raja Presentation Vol. 127sanskritization of MIA. *vādala- (< vārdala-):not convincing. — Rather der. from *vātāla- andconceived of as vā́ta- with āli-¹ (after which vātāvalī-)]

11578 vālāgra 'having a hair-like point' ṢaḍvBr., n. 'point of a hair' ŚvetUp. [vā́la-, ágra-]

11584 *vālguḍa 'bat', vālguda- m. Viṣṇ., vāgguda- m. Mn., valgula- m. 'flying fox' W., °lā- f. lex., °lī- f. Suśr.,vāguli- f. Kauṭ. 2. *vālduḍa-. [J. Bloch in ThomasEIS 35 ← Drav. Tam. vaval &c. [vibhīˊdaka- was affected by the names of the other two constituentsof the triphala-, viz. harītaka- and āmalaka-:thus vibhīˊtaka- after the former (in its turn replacedby harīṭaka- after vibhīṭaka-), while after the secondvibhēdaka- or *vibhēḍaka- was replaced by *vibhēlaka- (or MIA. -l- < -ḍ-). Initial v- was assimilated to b- by the following -bh- (cf. a similar assimilation invihvala-) and so appears in Pk. and all NIA. formsexcept M. — MIA. *vihīaa- → Pers. bih 'quince' Laufer584, whence back → NIA.: K. bih 'quince', S. behīf., H. bihī f.]

12045 vīṭā f. 'small piece of stick shaped like a barley-corn and struck in the game of tipcat' MBh., 'a kind ofmetal ball held in the mouth in penance', vīṭaka- n.'a roll of betel and areca nut' Pañcad., vīṭikā- f. 'id.'Daś., 'knot of a garment' lex., vīṭī- f. 'the betel plant'lex. [This belongs to a group of words characterizedphonet. by (1) initial v, b or zero, (2) ĭ̄ or ē or ū˘ or ō,(3) a single or double retroflex or dental stop, voicedor unvoiced, with or without nasal; and semant. bya general meaning of 'something round or rolled' andmore particularly as (1) 'a drop', (2) 'a lump', (3) 'a pador mat', (4) 'something wrapped or wrapping', (5) 'around stalk, stem, stick, handle': any of these meaningsbeing liable to occur in any of the phonetic forms.Austro-as. connexions have been proposed for someby Kuiper PMWS 32. See also vīṭī-, viṭápa-,vŕ̥nta-¹, bindú-, índu-, iṇḍvà, uṇḍuka-]

'animal living in holes' Suśr., 'cat' VS.,vr̥śadatī- 'ep. of cat' AV., viṣadaṁṣṭrā- f. 'plant usedas antidote to snake-bite' lex. (similarly śŕ̥ṅgika- m.(lex.), śārṅgaviṣa- n. (Yājñ.) (~ vŕ̥ścika- ?). Semant. for 'parasite ~dog' cf. kōká- and vr̥ṣadaṁśa- above (J. C. W.). — vŕ̥ka-, daṁśa-]

12126 vēśa³ m. 'prostitution' Mn. Pāṇ.gaṇa, 'brothel' Mn. [From vḗṣa-¹ m. 'work', vēṣá- 'working' VS. (viṣṭi-² f.'service, (coll.) servants, slaves' MBh., vēṣya- n.'work' TāṇḍBr.) infl. by vḗśa-² (as 'house' or as'ingress'): cf. further vēśasthā- f. 'prostitute' Br.,vēśastrī-, vēśyastrī- f. MBh. (whence vēśyā- Mn.).Semant. cf. bandhakī- f. 'prostitute' MBh., bandistrī-- f. 'apsaras' (J. C. W.)]
12130 vēṣṭá m. 'band, noose' Kauś., 'enclosure' lex., °aka- m. 'fence', n. 'turban' lex. [√vēṣṭ]
12131 vēṣṭana n. 'enclosing' Gr̥Śr., 'bandage, band' MBh., °aka- m. 'a method of coitus' lex. [√vēṣṭ]

MIA. *vracc- either anal.formation for which the starting-point is not clear(from NW. *vrayati, cf. Aś.shah. -y- < -j-, after typePk. payaï ~ paccaï) or X vacyátē 'moves' RV. [√vraj]

12235 *ŚAK² 'go'. [In opt. śakyām, desid. śíkṣati² (distinct from śaknṓti, śakḗma, śíkṣati¹ BR) 'provide' < 'drive,bring' in gōtrā́ śíkṣan (Ge. 'zuwenden'), urváśīm úpaśikṣāmi (Ge. 'locke her') RV.; śíkṣatē 'moves' in RV.1, 28, 3. Cf. Av. sak- 'to be past (of time)', pairi-sak- 'to last', frasaxta- 'dead', Pahl. sažēd 'passes, isfitting' (J. C. W.). — See √ṣvaṣk]
12236 śákaṭa n. (m. R.) 'cart' ŚāṅkhŚr., śakaṭīˊ- f. RV., śakaṭiká- adj. Pāṇ.gaṇa, °kā- f. 'small cart' Mr̥cch.2. *śaggaṭa-. 3. *śakkaṭa- or *chakkaṭa-. [√śak²?]

12256 śakvara-, śāk° m. 'bull' lex., śakkara-, śāk° Hcar., śakkari-, śārkkara-, śāṅkara-, śaṅka- lex. [Cf. śákvan- (f. °varī-) 'skilful, powerful' VS. AV., m. 'elephant'lex., śākvará- 'mighty (of bull)' AV., m. 'bull (?)' VS. — √śak¹]

12270 *śaṭṭa 'defective'. 2. śaṭha- (and *śaḍa-) 'deceitful' Āpast., 'cheat, fool, idler' W. 3. śaṇṭhá-¹ m. 'rogue,fool' lex., 'impotent' Uṇādis. 4. *śaṇṭhara-.5. ṣaṇḍhá-, v.ll. śa°, sa°, ṣaṇḍa-³, śa° m. 'eunuch' Gr̥Śr.,°aka- m. MBh., ṣaṇḍhī- f. 'woman without menstrualperiods or breasts'. [Poss. connexions in Mu. PMWS80. — In words containing a sibillant it is impossibleto determine whether the NIA. forms with unaspiratedretroflex represent an original aspirate or not: theaspirate and unaspirated forms are therefore groupedtogether, although the presumption from similar 'defective' word-groups is that the two series existed inthis group also. — Cf. the group *śuḍa- (śuṇṭhá-,*śuṇḍha-, *śūḍha-², *śōṭṭha-¹, *śōṭha-¹, *śōṇṭha-, *śōruṇḍa-, śōla-) and similar groups s.vv. kuṇṭha-,*ṭuṇṭa-², *naṭṭa-, baṇḍá-, *bukka-⁴, *maṭṭa-,*rakka-, *lakka-¹, vaṇṭa-². — Cf. *śaṇṭha-² 'lump']
12281 śatápad 'having a hundred feet' RV., m. 'centipede' Suśr., śatapadī- f. Suśr. [śatá-, pád-²]

'procuress' lex. ~ saṁbhalá- m. 'matchmaker' AV.):NIA. forms show no aspiration]

12338 śarkarā² f. 'candied sugar' Hariv., °ra- in cmpd. MBh. [Ac. to J. Przyluski MSL xxii 208 Pa. sakkharā-,of Mon-Khmer origin, was identified with MIA.sakkarā- < śárkarā-¹ and therefore applied spec. togritty or pounded sugar. If so, the identification of thetwo words was early enough for a form with ś- to befound in NWPk. (NiDoc. śakara from which theDardic forms derive and which → Pers.) and for theaspirate of the word for 'sugar' to have affected theAryan word for 'gravel' in Pali]

'havingpods' from śimba- ?) replaced śalmalí- which (of nonAryan origin?), besides śālmali-, had several otherforms in NIA.: *śambali-, *śāmali- in Pk., *śambhali- in P., *śalmari- in G., *śaṁvari- in M.]

13085 sájati 'is attached, embraces' Dhātup. (ásakta aor.'adhered to' TBr., ā́sajāmi 'place in' RV.). 2. *sājayati.3. sañjayati 'attaches to' Bhag., 'couples' Mn.4. sajyátē (sajjatē MBh.) intr. 'hangs on' ŚBr., 'isoccupied with' MBh. 5. saktá- 'clinging to' AV.[Kaf. Dard. K. and WPah. presuppose MIA.*ṣā̆y)-, *ṣajj- (*ṣacc-), *ṣatta-. These may derive from√sañj with ṣ- replacing s- in the simplex after cmpds.with ati (AV.), vyati (TBr.), anu (ŚBr.), abhi (MBh.),ni (RV.), pari (MBh.), prati, vi (TS.), adhivi (MBh.),abhivi (BhP.). Dhp. has ṣaǵa- ~ saṅgá- Brough Dhp101. Cf. similar replacement of dental by retroflex in√sthā, √stambh. T. Burrow's (BSOAS xii 650)assumption of a √*sraj ~ √*sañj is unlikely and unnecessary.All NIA. words under 1 and 2 (exceptKho. šoyek in which š- can derive only from ś- or ṣ-,since śr- is preserved) phonet. and semant. equallywell (1) < śráyati in Si. sayanavā, (2) < śrāyayati(IIFL iii 3, 170, Buddruss Woṭ 125, Burrow KharDoc14). But this would not account for their associationwith intr. or pass. stem *ṣajj- or *ṣacc-, and pp. and pret.*ṣatta-. Possibly śráyati and *ṣajati coalesced in NIA. asa pres. st. for which only *ṣajj- (replaced anal. by *ṣacc-)and *ṣatta- served as pass. — intr. and pp. Thus Paš.chil.ṣītik 'it has stuck' may be *ṣia- < śritá- X *ṣatta-. — √sañj]

'fresh' see also sadyás,sadyōja-.]

13955 hatá 'struck, killed' RV., hataka- 'struck, wretched' Mr̥cch., m. 'coward' lex. [√han¹]
13958 hatyā f. 'killing' only in cmpd. (muṣṭihatyā́- RV.) till Subhāṣ. [√han¹]
13964 hanana (f. °nī-) 'killing' Hariv., n. 'act of killing or striking' Nir. [√han¹]
13965 hanu¹ (n. PW.) 'weapon, death, disease' lex. [Based on hánu- n. 'part of spear'? (J.C.W.). — √han¹]
13966 hánu² f. 'jaw' RV., hánū- f. TS., hanukā- f. VarBr̥S.
13967 hanūmant m. 'the monkey chief' MBh., hanumant- m. R. [hánu-²]

13972 *habba 'defective'. [The group of defective words with initial h- show the same variation of vowel (i, ē ~u, ō, except in *habba-) and of interior consonant as thesimilar groups beginning with other consonants; see*bukka- ⁴ for a list of such groups. But they are lesswidely spread in NIA. — Cf. *hiṅga- (*hēṅga-,*hōkkha-, *hōgga-), *hijja-² (*hējja, *hēñja-, *hucca-,*hōccha-), *hiḍḍa- (*huḍḍa-, huṇḍa-²), *hēndara-,*hōppa- (*humma-), *hulla-², *hussa-]
13974 hambhārava m. 'lowing' MBh., hambārava- Hariv. v.l., Rājat. [hambhā-, ráva-¹]
13975 hámmati 'goes' Naigh. (used in Surāṣṭra ac. to Pat.).

13982 hariṇá 'yellow' MaitrUp. 2. m. 'deer' RV., hariṇīˊ-¹ f. 'doe' TS., hariṇaka- m. 'small deer' Kād.[Ac. to J. Przyluski JA 1929, 319 hariṇá- 'deer' ←Austro-as., but Mu. words there quoted are ← IA. — hári-]
13984 harit 'fawn-coloured', m. pl. 'horses of the sun' RV. [hári-]
13985 hárita 'yellow' RV., 'green' Śiś., haritaka- 'greenish' MW., n. 'vegetable matter' Car. 2. hārita- 'green'W., °taka- n. 'vegetable matter' lex. [hári-]
13987 haritāla '*green'. 2. m. 'green pigeon' lex. (°laka- m. 'pigeon' lex.). 3. n. 'yellow orpiment' MBh.4. *hāritāla-. [hári-]
13988 haritālī-, °likā- f. '3rd or 4th day in light half of month Bhādra' lex.
13991 haridraka-, °dra- m. 'yellow sandal tree' VarBr̥S. 2. harídru- m. 'a partic. yellow tree' ŚBr. [haridra-]
13992 haridrā¹ f. 'Curcuma longa, turmeric (its powdered root)' Kauś. 2. hāridrá- 'dyed with turmeric' ŚBr.[haridra-]
13997 harītaka m. 'the yellow myrobalan tree Terminalia chebula' Suśr., °takī- f. lex. [< hárita- infl. byvibhīˊdaka-, which with it and āmalaka- formed thetriphala-. — hári-]
14001 *hala² 'sudden movement, shaking'. [~ *halla-. - Cf. halahalaka- m. 'eagerness' Hcar., halahalāexclamation of applause MBh.? — √*hal]
14005a †halabhr̥ti- f. 'ploughing, agriculture' lex. (halahati- f. id. W. ← MIA.). [halabhr̥t- 'plough-bearer (name ofBalarāma)' MBh. — or poss. halá-¹ + bhr̥tí- 'subsistence']
14010 halasīra m. or n. 'plough' BHS ii 618. [halá-¹, sīˊra-]
14014 halēṣā f. 'pole of a plough' Pat. 2. halīṣā- Pat. [halá-¹ and hali-, īṣā́-]
14018 *hallati intr. 'moves, shakes', hallana- n. 'tossing about' lex. [~ *halati. — See √*hall]
14024 hásta m. 'hand' RV., 'forearm as measure of length' VarBr̥S.
14025 hastaka m. 'hand' MBh., 'a measure of length' in dvihastikā- ŚārṅgS. [hásta-]
14034 *hastavr̥tta 'set in motion by hand'. [Cf. hastavartam 'to be turned by hand' Bhaṭṭ. — hásta-,vr̥ttá-]
14036 hastasaṁjñā f. 'sign with the hand' Jātakam. [hásta-, saṁjñā́-]
14037 hastāmalaka n. 'the seed or fruit of myrobalan in the hand (as an emblem of something clear or palpable)'R. [hásta-, āmalaka-]

14039 hastín 'having hands, clever with the hands' RV., (with mr̥gá-) 'elephant' RV., m. 'elephant' AV.,hastínī- f. AV. [Aryanization of karin- which wasperh. non-Aryan in origin (see karabhá-), but associatedby pop. etym. with kará-¹ 'hand'? — hásta-]
14041 hástiya metr. (in cmpds.) for hástya- 'prepared with with the hand' RV., 'being on the hand' TS., 'held inthe hand' TBr. [hásta-]
14042 *hastirūpa 'having the form of an elephant'. [hastín-, rūpá-]

14050 *hāṇḍa 'pot', haṇḍikā- f. 'earthen pot' Subh. [Cf. hāḍikā- f. 'id.' Kathārṇ. and *haḍappha-. — Connexion,if any, with bhāṇḍa-¹ not clear. — LM 427compares Hsüan-Tsang's utakia-hanch'a (= *udakahāṇḍa), but this may be < *udaka-bhāṇḍa-]
14057 hāyaná 'annual, lasting a year', m. (n. Pur.) 'year' AV. [hayana-¹]
14058 hāyi 'exclamation used in chanting a sāman' MBh.
14059 hāra² m. 'necklace' MBh., °aka- m. 'string of pearls' Pañcat.
14060 hāraka 'ravishing' Pañcar., m. 'a kind of prose composition' lex., hārikā- f. 'a kind of metre' Col.[hāra-¹. — √hr̥]
14061 hārayati 'causes to be taken' MBh., 'has taken from oneself, loses' Kathās. [√hr̥]
14063 hārīta m. 'the green pigeon' MBh., °aka- m. Pañcat., hārita- m. lex. [hári-]
14064 hā́rdi n. 'interior of body' RV., m. 'heart' AV. [hr̥d-]
14067 hāliká 'relating to the plough' Pāṇ., m. 'ploughman' Pañcat. [halá-¹]
14071 hāsya 'laughable, funny' MBh., n. 'laughter' Yājñ. 2. *hāsiya-. [Cf. hāsikā- f. 'laughter' lex. — √has]
14072 hāhābhūta 'crying hā hā' MBh. ['*demon' (with play on bhūta-), whence hāhā- (and hūhū-) m. 'nameof a Gandharva' Kauś., hahā-, huhū- m. MBh., Pk.hā̃hā-, hūhū-, m. (J.C.W.). — hā¹, bhūtá-]
14073a *hikk-² 'drive'. [Same as √hikk¹, cf. hikkati 'makes an inarticulate sound' Dhātup. — Cf. √hakk]
14076 hiṅkarōti 'lows (as a cow after its calf)' Br. (híṅkr̥ṇōti RV.). [híṁ, karṓti]
14078 *hiṅga 'defective'. 2. *hēṅga-. 3. *hōkkha-. 4. *hōgga- [For list of 'defective' words with initial h- see *habba-]
14079 hiṅgú m. 'the plant Ferula asafoetida' BhP., n. 'substance prepared from its root', °uka- m. 'theplant' MBh. [hiṅgupattra- = iṅguda-]

14080 hiṅgula m.n. 'preparation of mercury with sulphur, vermilion', °luka- m. VarBr̥S., °laka- n. MBh., °li- m.lex. [Cf. hiṅgulu-, °likā- f., hiṅgūla- n., hiṅgudī- f.'names of various plants' prob. conn. iṅguda-: noteBi. H. forms < *iṅgula-]
14084 *hijja² 'defective'. 2. *hējja-. 3. *hēñja-. 4. *hucca-. 5. *hōccha-. [With *hōccha- cf. *ōccha-.For list of 'defective' words with initial h- see *habba-]
14085 hijjala m. 'the tree Barringtonia acutangula' lex., hijja-¹ m. lex.
14087 *hiḍḍa 'defective'. 2. *huḍḍa-. 3. huṇḍa-² m. 'blockhead' lex. [For list of 'defective' words withinitial h- see *habba-]
14093 hintāla m. 'the marshy date-palm Phoenix paludosa' Hariv. [Cf. tāḍa-³]
14094 hindōla m. 'swing, swing cradle' lex., °laka- m. Pañcat., hindōlayati 'swings' Dhātup. 2. *hiṇḍōla-.[Cf. andōláyati and hillōla-. — √dul]
14096 himá m. 'cold, frost, snow (in himávant-)' RV., n. 'snow, hoarfrost' ṢaḍvBr., hímā- f. 'winter' RV.,himikā- f. 'hoarfrost' lex.
14097 *himakartā 'heap of snow'. [For gender cf. gartā- f. 'hole, cave' Pañcat. — himá-, kartá-¹]
14106 himānta m. 'end of the cold season' MBh. [himá-, ánta-]
14107 *himnara 'winter'. [Cf. *himna-, hḗman-¹: for formation cf. *aj̈nara- ~ahan- s.v. áhar-, Lat. itineris ~iter, &c. — himá-]
14115 hiláti¹ 'behaves amorously' Dhātup. (cf. ajihiḍat (lṓma) 'pulled' AV.). 2. hēlatē² 'sports' MBh.,hḗḍati 'behaves amorously' Dhātup. [√*hiḍ]
14116 *hilati² 'becomes accustomed to, becomes tame'. 2. Caus. *hēlayati. 3. *hēlā-² 'habit'. [Psht. el 'tame'← IA. — √*hil²]
14117 hilla¹ m. 'an aquatic bird' lex. [→ Psht. hīlaī 'duck' Rep¹ 53. — Cf. *hilla-², *jhilla-¹?]
14120 *hillati intr. 'moves, shakes'. [Cf. hiláti¹ 'dallies' Dhātup. and similar variation between *hallati and*halati. — See √*hill]

14123 hīḍati 'angers' (jihīḷa, hīḷita- RV., ahiḍat GobhBr., hīḍita- AV.). 2. hḗḍatē 'scorns' Dhātup. (hḗḷatē 'isangry' Naigh., áhēḷant- 'not angry' RV., hēlitavya- 'to be treated lightly' MBh., ahēḍamāna- 'not negligent'R. 3. *hēḍyati. [√hīḍ]
14124 hīná 'abandoned' RV., 'base, mean' ŚBr., 'inferior to' Mn., hīnaka- 'deprived of'. [√hā³]
14129 hīyátē (ŚBr.), hīˊyatē (TS.) 'lacks, loses (with abl. or inst.), is worsted' AV. [√hā³]
14132 huṁ, hūṁ (~ hū hū VarBr̥S.) 'an exclamation of doubt or fear or assent, a mystical syllable used in chanting'ŚrS.
14133 huṁkarōti 'makes the sound huṁ' MBh., 'addresses roughly' Yājñ. 2. huṁkāra- m. 'a threatening sound'MBh. 3. hūṁkāra- MBh. [huṁ, karṓti]
14135a †*huḍa-² 'bolt or bar': WPah.J. hūṛ m. 'bolt above door', huṛnu 'to shut in'; kṭg. (kc.) hv̀ṛnõ 'to bolt (adoor)' Him.I 226.
14137 *huḍahāra 'sheep-taker'. 2. *huṇḍahāra-. [huḍa-, hāra-. — But Pk. huḍa- m. 'dog ~ ram', Or. huṇḍā'hyena'; and semant. cf. H. bheṛī 'sheep' ~ bheṛiyā'wolf']
14138 huṇḍikā f. 'bill of exchange' Rājat. [Cf. Pers. hunduwī 'id.', hundiyān, °yāwan 'commission on billof exchange']
14142 *hulla² 'defective'. [For list of 'defective' words with initial h- see *habba-]
14143 *hussa 'defective'. [For list of 'defective' words with initial h- see *habba-]
14145 hūṇa m. 'name of a barbarous people' MBh.
14146 hūˊrchati 'goes crookedly, totters, falls off from' MaitrS. [√hvr̥]
14151 *hr̥tkūṭa 'heart mass'. [Cf. hr̥tpiṇḍa- n. 'heart' W. — hr̥d-, kūṭa-². Or poss. < *hr̥tkakūṭa-, cf. Bshk.cmpd. hiku-kur 'heart']
14158 hḗḍa (hḗḷa- RV.) m. 'anger' AV., hēlā-¹ f. 'contempt, facility' Kāv. [√hīḍ]
14161 *hēndara 'defective'. [For list of 'defective' words with initial h- see *habba-]
14164 hēmantá m. 'winter' RV. 2. *hēmānta- (prob. in Paš. Kal. IIFL iii 3, 202 — with ā after *hēmānambeside loc. hḗman?).
14165 *hērati 'looks for or at'. 2. hēraka-, °rika- m. 'spy' lex., hairika- m. 'spy' Hcar., 'thief' lex. [J. BlochFestschrWackernagel 149 ← Drav., Kui ēra 'tospy', Malt. ére 'to see', DED 765]
14169 haima 'covered with snow' MBh., n. 'snow, hoarfrost' W. [himá-]
14170 haimantá 'wintry' VS., 'suitable for growing in winter' Suśr. 2. haímantika- VS. [hēmantá-]
14172 hṓ exclamation of summons or challenge or surprise TS.
14174 hōḍa m. 'raft, boat' lex. [← Drav., Kan. ōḍa., &c. DED 876]
14176 hṓtr̥ka m. 'assistant of the hṓtr̥-, priest' ŚBr. 2. hōtraka- m. AitBr.
14177 *hōppa 'defective'. 2. *humma-. [For list of 'defective' words with initial h- see *habba-]
14180 hōlaka m. 'half-ripe pulse cooked over a light fire' Bhpr.
14181 hōlaḍā-, hōlarā- f. 'name of a place in Kashmir' Rājat. [Cf. hōlā- f. 'name of a town' Rājat., hōlāḥ m. pl.'a country of Udīcya' lex.]
14182 hōlā f. 'spring festival' MW., hōlākā- f. Rājat., hōlī- f. W.
14185 hrīˊ f. 'shame' VS., hrīkā- f. lex. (áhri- RV., áhrī- ŚBr. 'bold'). [√hrī]
14186 *hrīyati 'is ashamed'. [Cf. pres. part. á-hrayāṇa- RV., jíhriyat- MaitrS., pp. hrīta- MBh. — √hrī]
14189 hválati 'goes crookedly, goes wrong, stumbles, falls' ŚBr. [hvárati tr. 'twists' Dhātup., úpa hváratē 'goescrookedly towards' RV., aor. hvārṣīt VS. — √hval]

[kálpa-, kalpya- (*kalpiya-). — √kI̊p]
Description: A Comparative Dictionary of Indo-Aryan Languages

14197 akṣōṭa [Poss. ext. of akṣa- (akṣa-² 'seed of Elaeocarpus ganitrus') with suffix -ṭa- (as in śarkōṭá- 'scorpion' AV. Wackernagel-Debrunner Suffixes 514)beside Ir. *axša-ra- in Oss. äxsärä H. W. BaileyBSOAS 20, 58. NIA. forms with -r- may then be< *akṣarōṭṭa- (cf. dimin. suffix -uṭṭa- in WPah. (e.g.Varma BhalDial 23). M. akroḍ (~ akroṭ) is X akhoḍrather than < *akṣarōṭṭa-]

14198 agní-¹: B. āgun, (Purnea) āgin, (SE) āun, āain (LSI V, i 360-3) < MIA. aggini- (from aggi- X agiṇi- ratherthan direct < agní- or with ODBL 152 early ← Sk.:cf. Pa. sakkunōmi ~ sakkōti < śaknṓti).
14199 aṅkapāli-: Gy. eur. angáli perh. rather ← Gk. ἀγκάλη GWZS 41.

14204 *ajya 'caprine'. [For suffix cf. Lith. ožỹs 'he-goat'< *āĝi̯os IEW 7. — Sh. ē̆ and P. i due to palatalizingeffect of following jj (for this in NWPk. see BroughDhp 81) rather than to derivation < *aiĝi̯o- (IE. *aiĝ- in Gk. αἴξ and *iĝ- in Ir. words meaning only'leather' IEW 13, EVP 105, H. W. Bailey BSOAS 21,539). — ajá-]
14205 añjana-: Si. an̆danā in mng. 'putting on (clothes)' rather < saṁdā́na- or sañjana-.

14216 anēnás-: H. Lüders BSBU 46 follows Kern in dissociating Pa. anēḷaka- and BHSk. anēḍaka- as ep.only of honey, and derives these from *ēḍa- in Pa.ēḷa-gala- 'speaking indistinctly' or 'dripping impurity'.But the NIA. mngs. perh. support derivation <anēnás-.
14217 antár: Pr. t- with abl. in -ā 'from within' (e.g. t-əwā́-müsṳ̄ 'fish from within water', -kurī 'dog fromwithin water, i.e. otter').
14218 ántya-: K. anz-manz 'within and in the middle', anzyumᵘ-manzyumᵘ 'middling, mediocre': or echowordof manz?
14221 †*andhakāratamasikā- 'darkness'. [Cf. andhatamasa- n. 'thick darkness' Pāṇ. and Pa. andhakāratimisa-. — andhakāra-, támas-]
14222 †andhakūpa- m. 'an overgrown well with mouth hidden' Kathās. [andhá-, kūˊpa-¹]
14226 ápatya-: forms of S. L. P. WPah. perh. infl. by Pers. bača 'young (of humans or animals)'. — Poss. assuffix in Sh. kuiōčh s.v. *kūpatya- Add.
14228 apavartana-: or poss. < *avavartana-. [Perh. Kho. ← early MIr. *vartana- (> Pers. vardana 'awooden roller such as a baker's' W. B. Henning)]
14230 †apāná- m. 'that of the five vital airs which goes down' TS., 'anus' MBh., 'fart' lex. [√an²]
14243 †árjuna- 'white, clear (of dawn, silver, &c.)' RV., 'made of silver' AV.
14249 *avanijyati: Paš.ar. äiž- < ava- not ā- (in ar. ō > ä, ε as e.g. in lεn < lavaṇá-).

14255 aṣṭamá-: Kaṭ. (Buddruss) aṭhám 'eighth'.

Back to the Search Page   |   Back to the DDSA Page
14262 ākāśá-: Dardic words, like Gaw. augā́š 'sky' (X avakāśa- ?), prob. early ← Sk. NOGaw 27.
14264 †*ākṣapāṭa- 'reaped rice (i.e. dried on the enclosure or platform)'. [akṣavāṭa-]
14266 *ākhēlati: poss. Paš.lauṛ. āxal-, gul. akal- 'to dance, play, cheat', dar. ā́xelik, weg. aḥalīˊk 'playing' IIFLiii 3, 23. — H. helnā rather < *hēlati.
14267 *ācakṣati: Wg. ā̃č-as- is pres. stem (ā̃č- < *ācakṣati); Woṭ. as- 'to say' Buddruss ZDMG 113, 353.
14268 ā́ñjana-: K. anzonᵘ m., anzan f. 'a kind of rice with white grains which is soft and sweet-smelling whencooked' (semant. cf. áñjas-, vyañjana-)? — Md.andun, adun 'collyrium'.
14270 †āntám 'to the end, completely, head to foot' TS., ŚBr. [ā, ánta-]
14272 ābhr̥ta-: beside Wg. āwərōm NTS xvii 234 has Wg. āwəṛom as fut. to āw- 'to bring' < āpayati.
14276 ārá-¹: After Sh. ro &c. add (cf. Phal. aṛo, f. aṛe with unexpl. -ṛ-).
14277 ārakṣin-: K. ārüchᷴ f. 'spare cloth remaining beyond seam when two pieces of cloth are sewn together'< ārakṣika- ?
14289 ā́śr̥ṇōti: Gy. serb. ašun- 'to hear' (W. P. Schmid IF 69, 147) is prob. from earlier šun- < śr̥ṇṓti.
14290 †ā́sajati 'fastens on, puts on (dress, armour)' RV., 'takes hold of' AV., 'takes up' MBh. [√sañj]
14291 *āsāṭa (āśātika- TA.) see words s.v. admasád-, esp. Or. aṁśāi.
14293 ā́harati: Paš. ar- (lauṛ.) 'to accept, agree', (dar. weg. kuṛ. chil. ar.) 'to hear', (LSI) har- 'to hear' (ratherthan < hárati).
14296 †irāvatī- f. 'name of a river in the Panjab' MBh.
14304 utkhanati. 2. utkhāta-: Sh.gil. okoyóĭki̯ 'to dig' (-o- < -ā- ?), cf. koh. khoyōnṷ s.v. khātá- Add.
14305 *utpaṭati. 2. utpāṭayati: Md. ufuran 'to pluck out, tear out'. 3. *utpaṭyati: Kal. upác̣- 'to pick, gather'.

14307 utphalati in mng. 'bursts' rather from √phal². — M. uphā̆ḷṇẽ in mng. 'to boil or bubble up, rise (of flame),spring up (of water), swell (with pride)' rather < *utsphalati Add. (√sphal²); Pk. upphālēi in mng.'raises' and M. uphāḷṇẽ 'to winnow' < *ut-sphālayatiAdd. (√sphal¹).
14308 útsa-: Paš.kṇḍ. unč 'spring'; — (with dimin. suffix) weg. dar. unčaṛék, chil. unčaṭik ZDMG 114, 445.
14314 *ut-sphurati: enter N. uphārnu 'to jerk up', M. upharṇẽ 'to winnow' s.v. *ut-sphārayati¹ Add.(√sphar¹).
14318 uddāna-¹: IIFL iii 3, 5 is reference for Paš. (add kuṛ.). — Gaw. hudin < *uddānī- NOGaw 37.
14322 udbudhyatē 'appears'. [Cf. údabudhran 'have come forth' RV., udbuddha- 'come forth, appearing' MW. — √budh]
14323 *ud-hadati [Not with BSBU 95 < upahad-. Rather ūh- < *uhh- < ud- (with unexploded -d) h- as in Pk.ūhasya- < *ud-has- (~ anal. uddhasati), Pa. ūhata- < *ud-hr̥ta- (~ anal. uddhaṭa-)]
14327 upaviṣṭa-: Sv. beṭho 'sat down' ← Phal. or Tor.; Woṭ. pret. baiṭhẽ.
14330 *ubdhrikā-: Paš.snj. ūˊlä 'spider's web'; — cf. Paš.kṇḍ. ə̃dr- 'to weave, build' Buddruss ZDMG 114, 445.
14331 *ubbā-: esp. H. ūbh perh. X (rather than, with P. Tedesco Language 22, 189 and Buddruss ZDMG114, 445, directly <) ūṣmán-.
14334 *r̥tuvanta-: Sh.gil. yōnṷ m. 'winter', pales. jij. yōn, koh. gur. yōdṷ. — Gy. eur. vend m. (~ yevénd, ivend)rather < hēmantá-.
14342 kákṣa-¹: Gy. pol. khak f. — As adv. and postp. OH. kahã, kahũ, H. kāhã, kāhũ, ko. — K. kǒchrather < kukṣí-.

14343 *kacca-¹: with emph. aspiration (rather than < *khacca- s.v. *kicca-): Dm. khača 'dirty, bad'; Gaw.khaċ, khas 'bad', Kal. khāčä 'bad, dirty (?)'; Sv. khačo'dirty, bad'; Phal. khāču 'bad', khāčo 'lie', khāčulo'dirty, bad'; Sh. khăčár f. 'ingratitude', khăčḗlū'miserly'.

14344 kacchapa-: Md. kahabu 'tortoise'.

14345 kaṭa-³: with -ṭ- (< -ṭṭ- ?) also Gaw. kā̆ṭa 'roofbeam', Paš.nij. lagh. kaṭīˊ 'tree', chil. xaṭo 'rafter', ar.xoṭo; Shum. xā̃ṭa 'rafter'.
14346 káḍāra-: Paš.weg. chil. xarāṛ (in which kh- > x- may be secondary G.M.).
14350 kaṇḍūyati: Gy. eur. xanov-, xaruv- (wel. also xatav-) 'to tickle', arm. xant- 'to itch' GWZS 1644.
14352 kapāla-: 1. Paš.pach. kawalā́ 'hard core of maize cob when all grains have been plucked off'; Kal. kawao'clay pot'.
14354 kapīta-: Kho. kΛwīr 'caper plant' → Sh. (Lor.) kawīr, kabīr (but both more prob. < karīˊra-²).
14356 *kamra [Cf. Sang. kamak 'back', Shgh. čomǰ (< *kamak G.M.) 'back of an animal', Yghn. kama'neck']
14359 karīˊra-²: Kho. (Lor.) kΛwīr 'caper plant', Sh. (Lor.) kawīr, kabīr with dissimilation of r-r. — BuddrussZDMG 114, 446 Sh. ← Kho. < kapīta- whichsemant. is less likely.
14365 *karta-³: Kt. (Bashg.) kaṛó 'knife' dial. form of WKt. kṭo < *kartaka- or *karttāra-.
14373 kalmaṣa-: Sh. kōmuš (if with genuine š, poss. < *kalmaṣya-) Buddruss ZDMG 114, 446.
14382 *kārti-: Gy. eur. kat f. 'shears, scissors' rather than < karttrī-.
14384 kā́śa-: other somewhat similar words for 'millet' in Dm. kā́raċ, Shum. karāċ, Phal. kā́ri, Kho. graċ(~ gras s.v. grāsa-), Sh.jij. garaṣ Buddruss ZDMG114, 447.
14388 *kiyatta-: with a from káti and other interrogatives; Gaw. kata 'how many?', Phal. katī, N. H. kati; — ext. -kk-; Dm. kadiki, Woṭ. katík, Mai. katuk, Tor.kadak.
14389 kilima-: cf. Sh.chil. kyεlo s.v. kiśara- and koh. gur. kēl m. 'resin'.

14395 *kuttūra-: (with expressive aspiration) Sh.koh. khŭtrō m. 'puppy'.

14396 kunta-¹. poss. ext. in Sh.gil. kŭnāli̯ f. 'stick', (Lor.) kunālo 'staff, walking-stick', koh. kŭndārhī 'stick'Buddruss.
14400 kúla-: Paš.lauṛ. plur. affix -kulā, °lī (not with Bloch IA 155 ← Psht. kəlaí 'village').

14401 kuśa-². 2. *kuśśa-: Sh. (Lor.) kuš, kušo prob. for kh° with Bailey ShGr. 3. *khuśśa- (→ Bur. khošo'crippled in hands or feet'); Gaw. khušá 'lame in arm',Kal. khūši, Kho. khuši; — with ṣ: Ash. kuṣö, Kt. kṣö,Pr. kšču, Dm. khuṣa, Phal. khuṣo; — 'left hand ~crippled' (cf. kharvá-): Pr. kṣu lust 'left hand', Dm.khuši das, kuṣāti; Phal. khuši hāt 'left hand', khušēti 'leftdirection, south'.

14404 *kūpatya-: Sh.gur. kuiōčh m. 'villager' (→ Mai.ky. kuōč 'villager', Bur. kuyōč 'subjects of a ruler'): prob.der. kúi (< kūˊpa-¹ or kuṭī-) with suffix -ōčh) (as inSh. koh. koṭōčṷ m. 'villager' ~ kōṭ 'village' < kōṭṭa-¹)of doubtful origin (< ápatya- ? Semant. cf. H.gãwār 'villager' < grāmadāra-).
14416 kṣārayati: NTS xii 165 relates Phal. c̣hōr- 'to put' which is however probably mistake for *čhōr- seechurayati Add.
14417 kṣiprá-: B. chip 'a swift boat or canoe' perh. rather < *sippī- S. K. Chatterji CR 1936, 290.
14432 khura-. 2. *khuḍa-¹: Gy. eur. (serb.) khurd (GWZS 1604) which with other spellings (e.g. germ. khur f.)has unexpl. kh- (~ "kfur" and wel. xur̄).
14434 khḗya-: Gy. eur. xev f. poss. owes -v and gender to guvá f. 'hole' < gúhā- Add.

14439 *gacca-: technical sense as 'plaster, mortar' (Pers. gač 'plaster') points to borrowing (Ir. <07> IA.).

14450 gr̥ṇā́ti '*tells' ('addresses, praises' RV.) resulted in MIA. and NIA. gaṇ-, giṇ-, guṇ- (see gaṇáyati,guṇáyati¹). 2. *girati³: Pk. giraï 'says'. 3. Caus.gārayatē 'teaches' Dhātup. 4. Pp. *gr̥ta-: Tir. gaṛ- 'to speak'. [√gr̥³]
14453 *gōgrāmaka-: Paš.snj. gōlūˊṅ (← a dial. in which gr > l, not gr as in snj.).
14454 gōṇī [But also in Ir., Sar. γaun 'coarse sack', Bal. gōn-dōš 'pack needle'. Cf. also Schwyzer ZII 6, 240and Charpentier MO xviii 33]
14457 gōla-¹: Phal. gūli f. 'bread'. — Niṅg. gṓlə 'mulberry tree' ~ Shum. gṓlə 'tree' scarcely belong here.
14459 granthana-: Sh. gΛnóni → or poss. ← Bur. ginani 'harvest festival, small sheaf of barley'.
14465 glātr̥-: Pr. gətərāk pp. of gətər- 'to become tired' ← Kt. gatərə 'tired' Buddruss.
14468 ghaná-²: *ghanta- ~ *ghanda- in Ash. gandalə 'heavy, pregnant' (rather than < *ghanatara-);Shum. gandalä 'heavy', Gaw. gandā́la, f. gandā́lī'pregnant'.
14470 *ghalōdaka-: -ōγ of Kho. golōγ extracted from other cmpds. with -udaka-.
14471 ghāṭā-¹: Kt. also gŕək 'throat' (rather than < grīvā́-), Pr. also gīk, gīŕg, Wg. grüik.
14473 †ghr̥ṇí- m. 'sunshine' RV., 'day (as opposed to night)' Hariv., 'ray of light' Ānand., 'flame' lex.[√ghr̥²]
14475 *ghraṇiṣya-: Paš.snj. grēnī 'noon' (Morgenstierne). But for the Paš. words see also ghr̥ṇí- Add.

14478 *CAGH: mng. of Aś. caghati is prob. 'is likely to' (paralled with laghaṁti with inf. < *alaghaṁti =*arghanti: cf. Pa. ἁ.λ. sagghasi with v.l. agghasi).Orig. mngs. of √*cagh: (1) 'rise' in B. cāgā (caggh- sanskritized as carghati 'goes' W.?); (2) 'rise against'in Kho. čagéik 'to overthrow' (cf. caghnōti 'kills',cahayati 'cheats' Dhātup.: semant. cf. √gur 'raise'~ gūryatē 'hurts, goes' Dhātup.); (3) 'is likely' in Aš.caghati and B. cāgā 'to be inclined' (J. C. W.). — Seealso √*cāh Add.
14480 catvā́raḥ: Md. hatara 'four' — All Paš. forms rather from čār (ar. chil. ō < ā) and either ← Ind. or, like Ind.,< *cayāri.
14482 cándati: ac. to G.Buddruss ZDMG 108, 412 Paš. chil. čānd- means not 'to shine', but 'to fall' like lauṛ.čhand- < ścandati.

14487 *carpa-: Ash. čapēṛa 'flat of hand' ← Psht. čapēṛa ← IA. e.g. P. capeṛ < *cappēṭa- s.v. capēṭa- Buddruss.

14490 caláyati: the Kaf, words with mng. 'summon' are c̣ā 'call, cry' (see śrāva-) with various verbs, Ash. lā- &c. (Buddruss).
14491 *cācca-: H. cacerā bhāī m. 'father's brother's son' see mātulēya- Add.

14492 *CĀH: poss. < *cāṅkṣati (~ kāṅkṣati) with regular c- reduplication from √kā (perf. cakḗ) or √kan (3 sg.pret. cākan) or √kam (intens. caṅkamyatē). *cāṅkṣ- > *cāṁkh- > *cākh- > *cāh- is exactly parallel tophonet. development of *dāṁṣṭra-. Poss. also >MIA. (NW?) *cāṅgh-, *cāggh- (→ EAś. cagh-, B. cāgās.v. *caghyati) J. C. W. — But (1) date of Aś. isearly for change ṅgh > ggh and for spread of theseforms to East; (2) S. caghu (with a) would imply earlyborrowing from E or S unless a separate *caṅkṣ- ~ *cāṅkṣ- (necessary for *cāh-) is assumed.
14494 citraka-: Gy. eur. čičay, SEeur. čiči despite LM 330 is ← Hung. cica 'cat' GWZS 3505.

14496 †cīmara- 'copper' in cīmara-kāra- 'coppersmith' in Saṁghāṭa-sūtra Gilgit MS. 37 folio 85 verso, 3(= zaṅs-mkhan in Tibetan Pekin text Vol. 28 Japanesefacsimile 285 a 3 which in Mahāvyutpatti 3790renders śaulbika- BHS ii 533. But the Chinese version(Taishō issaikyō ed. text no. 423 p. 971 col. 3, line 2)has t'ie 'iron': H. W. Bailey 21.2.65). [The Kaf.and Dard. word for 'iron' appears also in Bur.čhomār, čhumər. Turk. timur (NTS ii 250) may comefrom the same unknown source. Semant. cf. lōhá-]
14500 cúṇḍati: Bshk. čunuṭ, Phal. čuṇṇo do not belong here, but are < cūrṇa-.
14501 cūrṇa-: 1. Bshk. čunuṭ 'narrow' (which with Phal. čuṇṇo was wrongly attributed to cúṇḍati). 3. Md.huni 'lime, mortar'.
14504 *chaṭa-: M. saḍ, saḍā perh. a 'defective' word < śaṭha- s.v. *śaṭṭa-. 2. G. sāṭɔ, M. sāṭ, sāṭā rather <saṭṭa-².

14512 churayati: Sh. čhuróĭki̯ is not < *c̣hur- X čhŭbóĭki̯ s.v. chupáti nor ← K. s.v. kṣōṭayati, since evidencefor orig. kṣ- is prob. non-existent. MorgenstierneNOPhal 32 beside c̣hōr- (with which in NTS xii 165he compares Dm. c̣hār- s.v. kṣārayati) has also čōr- and in closely related Sv. Buddruss has čhor-, čhur-.
14525 jyḗṣṭha-: Pr. žeišti, žešt 'bull' NTS xv 282 (not with NTS ii 245 < r̥ṣabhá-): cf. vr̥ṣabhṓ jyā́yān RV. 3, 38,5 and jyḗṣṭha- as ep. of horse RV. 10, 78, 5. G.Buddruss ZDMG 114, 446.

14530 *jhalla-: NKal. ǰhau, obl. st. ǰhal- 'forest'.

14534 *ṭōṅka-: cf. also Paš.ar. ṭǟũgṓ 'scorpion'; Dm. ṭōṅk 'locust', Kal. ṭokur, Phal. ṭīṅkura.
14536 *ṭhōkk-: Kt. tku prob. misprint for *ṭku, cf. Kt. čim-ṭku 'iron nail' NTS vii 110, Wg. čum-ṭku.
14537 *ḍag¹: 2. Pr. ā-ẓuẓu- (NTS vii 90) rather < *ranz (cf. Kt. ranz, Kal. ronz) or < *rarz (cf. Pers. larz)NTS xv 304.
14539 *ḍikka-¹: Wg. (Lumsden) "dikáún" (NTS xvii 247) prob. for *ḍik-. Cf. Ash. Wg. ḍuk- 'to drive off',Paš. (LSI) ḍak-, she. ḍek-, kṇḍ. ḍug-, Sv. ḍik- BKPD 40.
14545 *ḍhukyati: Paš. ḍək- 'to get hold of, collect' IIFL iii, 3, 65.
14546 *ḍhūss-: poss. also Ash. Paš.chil. ḍūs 'hole'; Wg. ḍüs 'hole, vulva'; Paš.chil. Shum. dū˘m-dū˘s 'smokehole' (Buddruss).
14547 *ḍhēḍḍha-¹. 5. *dhiḍḍha-: Sh. (Lor.) diḍu rather with Bailey ShGr 138 ḍĭṛŭ (→ Bur. ḍīru) <4. *ḍhiḍḍha-. — Delete diḍiro which is typing errorfor Sh. biḍĭ̄ro (→ Bur. biḍiro).
14550 tathāpi: cf. Kt. te 'indeed' (emphasis on preceding word), Kal. ta.
14553 tanūpā́-: Wg. tánuo (NTS ii 265) better analysed as tanü-ō 'he is a friend' NTS xvii 304.
14554a tapti-: Gy. eur. tati also 'stove, room' W. P. Schmid IF 70, 221.
14562a tāráyati: Gy. eur. tar- 'to give way to' W. P. Schmid IF 70, 221.
14563 tā́lu-: Md. tala 'palate'; — Kal. istáli, if rather < sthala-, ← Kaf. before change of ist- > išt-.
14564 *tipūrayati: Pr. tür- is prob. Pr. cmpd. of ti)- < antár with -ür- < pūráyati.
14565 †*timyati 'is still'. [timita- 'still, motionless' R. - Cf. stīmá- 'sluggish, stagnant' (J. C. W.)]
14566 tiraścá-: Kho. Tirīč Mēr name of a mountain (Ter° Rep¹ 69).
14568 tucchyá-: Gy. eur. also šučo, ǰuǰo 'empty' (which collide with *śucya-), Md. hus. — Phal. Sh.koh. tiš'empty' ← Psht. təš (Buddruss).
14573 tuvám: Wg. Kt. nom. tü, obl. tū (< táva), Paš. sham. nom. tu, gen. tau (obl. tọ̈̄ < *tā < ?).

14576 *tr̥pu-: Kt. trü 'curdled milk', trü- 'to curdle'; Ash. truga-zū 'sour milk', Pr. čüū. — Sv. λuǰ- 'to becomesour' (< *tr̥pūya- ?) in λuǰij̈ilo (c̣hīr) 'sour milk'(λužizilo NOPhal 50), Gaw λuzan-c̣hīr, luzizan- <*λuzi-san (absol. in -i of λuz- with pres. part. *santa- (Buddruss).
14593 dánta-: Md. dat, dai 'tooth'. — Pr. letəm not 'my tooth' but with -m from wrong division of letəmusuk <dantamāṁsa- ? (Buddruss).
14595 dala-⁴: Paš.lauṛ. ḍal f. 'herd, flock; pl. suffix', shut. dal 'many'.
14608 dīrghá-: Md. digē 'long'. — Paš. lik-, Shum. līg- 'to lay down' and Bshk. likeg- 'to lie down' are denominatives(Buddruss).
14610 *dumbha 'tail': for Dard. forms with l- and Kho rūm see *lumba-³, lūma-.
14611 †*durgrahiṇī- 'having spasms'. [Cf. durgraha- m. 'evil demon of illness, spasm, cramp' Suśr., 'whim'Kathās. — gráha-]
14612 *duvāra-: Kt. du 'door' (-uā- > ū with reg. loss of -r after long vowel), Wg. dōr, dō (rather than < dúr-).
14613 duhyátē: Relationship of regular Gy. eur. thūǰ- ("thūtsch- ", "tohsch- ") with more frequent doš- (GWZS 541) is not clear.
14619 dēvá-¹: Kt. dε 'god', Yum-dei, voc. deyo, de-put 'the Milky Way', Kmd. de 'angel'. — Pr. lūžū 'demon'(lū- < dēvá- +?) G.M.
14625 *daivatama-: Kt. dεyume rather to be divided délũ dε yume 'O Yum, god of the divine beings' G.M.
14631 *dramaṇa-: Kt. drum 'a sweet-smelling plant'; Kal. dřä̃řu 'Artemisia'. — *dramna- also in Shgh. ċūδm'Artemisia', Yghn. dirawna.
14632 dravá [*drawa- also in Ir. with mng. 'hair': Khot. dro, Shgh. ċīw, Yazgh. ċū, Yghn. daraw, Oss. aerdu]
14633 †*drāhyatē 'is stretched out'. [Cf. drā́ghatē 'lengthens, is tired' Dhātup. EWA ii 75. — dīrghá-]
14634 druṇa [Gender of druṇā- (~ m. in WPah.) attested in Ir. Shgh. ċan f., WOss. aerdunae (G.M.)]
14640 *dvivatsikā-²: Kt. dəwší '2 or 3 year old goat or sheep' (š < tsy with secondary suffix -i?).
14641 *dhakk-: with altern. forms of H. M. with ḍh- cf. Sh. ḍăk thoĭki̯ 'to hammer (nails &c.)'.
14642 dhánu-². 2. dhánvan-²: Kt. dúmə 'waterless place', dumā 'dry (crops)', dəm-ǰaläí 'a kind of duck living onland', (Davidson) dam-kol-wā 'in a dry year'.

14646 dhavatē: K. dawun 'to run', pog dhaũnu 'to walk'; ext. in pog. dhaũtulnu 'to run', WPah.khaś. dhabṛnu(pret. dhavṛā), Or. dhupibā: all rather than < dhā́vati¹. — Or. dhuāĩbā < dhāváyati¹ or *dhavayati.
14649 dhiṣáṇā-: Ash. däsäni also name of a goddess. — Pr. dĭ̄snīˊ ← Kt.
14654 *dhmātra-: Gaw. dāntar 'fireplace'; — cf. Tor. dadan (X Psht. Pers. dēgdān? AO viii 302).
14655 dhrā́yati: 2. Pr. lār- is a cmpd. verb only (lā < adhi +ā with -r- < pūráyati Add.) 'to fill right up',lār-ok-sum 'I have been filled up, i.e. am replete'(Buddruss).
14656 nagará-: Kt. (in a myth) niṅar 'castle'; Kal. Náṅgar 'name of a village south of Drosh' → Kho. Naγar ~noγor).
14664 nīta² [Cf. Shgh. dial. nid pret. of nay- 'to churn', and for √*nī² in Ir. H. W. Bailey IL xvi 116 ff.]
14668 paṇḍitá [For paṇḍita- ~ paṇḍa- semant. cf. 'defective' word for 'wizard' in H. bhõkas s.v. *bhukkhara-]

14668a *paddhara- 'level, straight'. [Cf. prādhvaná- 'bed or course of a river' RV., prādhvara- (unexpl. epithetof śākhā- 'branch') Cat., prādhva- '*advancing,*straight' ('travelling' Pāṇ.com., °vē 'at the head of'Kāṭh., °vam 'suitably, properly' R., 'conformably'Āpast. -prādhva- X prahva- in prādhvaṁ kr̥tvā'laying down' MBh., prādhvam 'humbly' Hcar.);paddhara- < prādhvara- would be (rather than anancient r/n variant of prādhvaná-) a MIA. ext. ofprādhva- ~ *prādhva-t- in paddhati- f. 'way' Hariv.,*prādhva-ḍ- in paddhoḍī- (musical term) Saṁgīt.,*prādhvā-r- in *paddhārayati (Pk. pādhāraī withEMIA. ādh < āddh) 'travels'. -paddharaṇī- (sthālī-)f. '(bowl) for collecting the scooped footprint of thesoma-cow' ŚrS. (Caland-Henry Agniṣṭoma p. 38) conceivedof by pop. etym. as containing pad-haraṇa- (J. C. W.). — ádhvan-]
14676 †párivrajati 'wanders about' ŚBr., 'do. as a mendicant' Mn. [√vraj]
14680 parút: for -s of K. parus cf. pröryus s.v. parā́ri. - Kaf. forms rather < pūˊrva-.
14682a *paṣṭāna- [Psht. paštūn rather < *parswāna- G. Morgenstierne AO xvii 138 ff., TPS 1948, 75]
14683 pāṁśu-: Gy. eur. poši) &c. ac. to Miklosich Mund viii 51 ← Arm. phoši 'dust'.
14687 pāramī [pāramitā- is hyper-Sk. and hyper-Pa. for *pāramiyā- from *pāramya- n. ~ pāramī- f. (typesāmagrya- ~ sāmagrī-) J. C. W.]
14688 pārśvá-: 1. Kho. pāz rather ← Wkh. pūz < Ir. *pāza- H. W. Bailey BSOAS xii 325.
14695 pīˊvas-: Paš.lauṛ. pəī, ar. chil. kuṛ pīeu, al. pōi, pī 'meat' (rather than < piśitá-).
14696 púruṣa-: OMd. piris, Md. firi 'male'. — Pa. pōsa- m. 'man'; Gy. arm. póša 'name of the Gypsies of AsiaMinor among Armenians and Turks', boša 'do.among Georgians' Miklosich Mund viii 51.

14698 pūráyati: Pr. -ür- in t-ür- 'to fill in', -r- in a-r- 'to fill up', bi-r- 'to fill (a vessel standing lower)', lā-r<->(lā < adhi + ā: not < *dhrāta) 'to fill right up'(Buddruss); — Md. furān 'to fill'.
14700 pr̥ṣṭhá-: Gy. eur. (Colocci) "pùshto" m. 'back', as. püšto (poss. infl. by or ← Pers. pušt), Sv. priš; Md.fuřu 'side'.
14701 pēśalá-: Tor. pišal (f. °šel) 'smooth'; K. piśolᵘ 'smooth, tender, soft (of woollen goods), delicate'(whence piśelun 'to become soft'): rather than <picchala- ?
14702 *pōḍ-: Gy. eur. pur- 'to burn, singe' (not with GWZS 2631 ← Gk. πυ̑ρ).
14703 prakāśatē: Kt. pakċe- is prob. a Kt. cmpd. with verbal prefix pa- (G.M.).
14704 *pragāmaka-: Ash. ċipŕá̃̄, ċiplá̃̄ 'lamb' poss. to be analysed as ċi- (< ?) +pŕā̃ < *prām or < prāṇá- (G.M.).
14705 práṇīta [Pa. paṇīta- in mng. 'excellent' (whence mng. in BHSk.) was rather hyper-Pa. ← paṇya- 'commendable' ĀpŚr. (paṇā́yya- ŚBr., paṇitavya-,paṇāyita- W.) J. C. W.]
14706 †pratikarōti 'does against' AitBr., 'returns (good or evil)' MBh. 2. Pp. pratikr̥ta- R., n. 'requital' MBh.[√kr̥¹]
14708 priyáṅgu-: K. pinga f. (Lawrence) 'Panicum miliaceum' (→ Shgh. pinǰ 'millet, prob. P. miliaceum');Sh. c̣iṅ f. 'millet' (not < *cīnaka- s.v. cīna-²) < older*priṅg → Ḍ. péreṅ 'millet'.
14710 †prōthá- m. 'nostrils of a horse, snout of a hog' MBh. [√pruth Add.]

14711 plúṣi [All forms with initial pr-, ṭḷ-, pl-, λ-, p- are prob. < early MIA. pr- < OIA. pl-. In Sh. (in whichOIA. pr- > c̣-), since in all other lggs. this MIA. pr- <pl- merges with OIA. pr-, prī˜ẓu is prob. ← Phal.prī˜ṣu rather than that pl- > pr- after the change ofOIA. pr- towards c̣-. — Similarly in all MIA. (incl. lateSk., e.g. Dhātup.) and NIA. words with pr- or p- (~pil-) < OIA. pl-: see plakṣá- (prakṣá-), plīhán-, √plu,√pluṣ (√pruṣ²), plōta-. — The same developmentoccurred in OIA. ml- > (mbr-: see mlḗcchati; andin OIA. kl- > kr- (which outside NW > k-) or kil-:see *klava-, klānta-, *klāvyatē, √klid, √kliś(√*kriś), klṓman-. — Similarly with voiced initials:gl- > gr- (~ gil-) in glāní- and vl- > vr/br- invlēpita-. — It is to be noted that in all these words(except vlēpita- with only an Ir. congener and theetym. obscure plakṣá-) l corresponds with an IE. l. — Similar development in K. śr- < śl- (śrônᵘ < ślakṣṇa-)]

14712 phalph-: Also in N. phāp 'prosperity, growth', phāpnu 'to be suitable'; A. phāpiba 'to be effective (ofdrug or incantation)'; — *phabb- (< *pharb-)? in K.phabun 'to be suitable or becoming'; S. phaḇaṇu 'tosucceed'; P. phabbṇā 'to look well'; H. phābī 'fitting',phabnā 'to adorn, be suitable, swell with pleasure'; — *phavv- (< pharv- in prapharvīˊ- 'wanton girl' RV.) inPk. phavvīhaï 'is successful in getting' (or for *phabbhī°< *pharbhīyati?); G. phāvvũ 'to succeed'; M.phāvṇẽ 'to be suitable'. — See also *sparvati.
14713 phālguná-: Paš.lauṛ. phālgūn 'second autumn month' early ← Sk. IIFL iii 3, 152.
14715 badhnā́ti: Kal.rum. bhon-, urt. bhān- 'to bind' (with -n-, not -nd-) rather than < bandhati. — WPah.badhāwṇu 'to extinguish' (like P. vadhāuṇā) is <várdhatē q.v.
14723 *būra-: 2. S. bhuraṇu 'to crumble', L. bhuraṇ; H. bhurbhurā 'powdery': rather than < bhuráti.
14725 bráhman-¹: Ash. blamadḗ name of a god ← Ind. cf. Sk. brahmadēva- NTS ii 247.
14726 *bhabh-: Gy. rum. phab- (< *bhabbh-), 3 sg. phaból 'burns, is hot', phabar- 'to set alight' (MiklosichMund viii 38).
14727 bhálatē 'attends to, observes, makes an observation, speaks' Dhātup. [√bhal¹]
14730 bhā́ma-¹: with G. bhām f. cf. bhāmā- f. 'wife of Kr̥ṣṇa' Kathās. (~ Caṇḍī = Durgā). Semant. ef.caṇḍa-¹ ~ candrá- for der. of √bhām &c. frombhāma-¹ (√bhā) (J. C. W.).

14737 márīci [In MIA. there may have been contamination of mr̥gá- with márīci-: cf. mriga- in Aś., *mirga- in WPah., *mriṅga- in Phal. ~ Pk. mirīi- < márīci-.Thus orig. *marīcitr̥ṣṇā- 'thirst for (what is in fact)rays' (~ marīcipá- VS.) > *mirīiaṇhā- from whichhyper-Sk. mr̥gatr̥ṣṇikā-: cf. late mr̥gatōya- ~marīcitōya- BhP. (J. C. W.)]
14740 maryā́dā-: L. mērā m. 'high land, sandy soil', P. mairā m. (→ Psht. maira 'desert, steppe' EVP 46).
14741 mála-: Gy. eur. mel f. 'dirt, dust' (GWZS 1928) poss. like P. H. mail f. < *malin-, melalo 'dirty, unclean'(in mng. 'black' infl. by Gk. μελανός).
14741a *malladvīpa-: so SED 463: doubtful bec. of ā in Md. māldiv. Prob. conn. mālē name of the principalisland and atoll.
14742 maśáka-: Pa. makasa- has same metathesis as in Ir. Pers. magas, &c. (G.M.).

14744 mahiṣá-: Kt. meṣi-aṣe (r̥ṣabhá-) m., -go (gava-) f. 'buffalo'.

14745 mātulēya-: L. mavlēr &c. rather < *mātulēra- with patronymic suffix -ēra- ~ -ēya- as in dāsērá- ~dāsēyá- (Pāṇ. 4. 1. 131): cf. H. cacerā bhāī m. 'paternalcousin', mamerā bhāī m. 'maternal cousin' ~ cācā,māmā < *cācca-, māma-.
14747 māma-: Kt. mam 'mother's brother'. — H. mamerā bhāī m. 'mother's brother's son' see mātulēya- Add.
14751 *murati¹: Gy. eur. mur- 'to rub, wash, wet' (or < *mr̥dati: in mng. 'to shave' < muṇḍayati).
14754 *muss-: L. muskaṇ 'to smile' (→ Psht.waz. məskai 'smiling'). — Paš. musa 'smiling' prob. ← Psht.musai ← IA. EVP 47.
14755 mūṣa-: Kt. (Bargromaṭal) musə́ m., (Kamdesh) muzə́ m. — Gy. eur. musó &c. with -s- infl. by Gk. μυ̑ς.
14757 mr̥taka-: Gy. eur. mulo m. 'corpse, ghost'. — Kt. mŕestə is perf. part. (G.M.).
14761 *mēcca-. 2. *mēñca-: Gy. eur. mīǰo 'bad, wicked' rather than < mithyā́ (GWZS 1957), but doubtful.
14762 mēda-: Bal. mēδ perh. ← an unrecorded Brah. form (G.M.).
14765 *mlāyita with mng. 'ground' retained from IE. *melə-: *mlē- as in Lat. molo &c. IEW 716.
14772 yūˊkā-: Kt. yū is f. — Delete Pk. ukka-piṁḍa-. — Pk. okkaṇī- f. 'louse' is connected rather with utkuṇa-.
14775 ráthyā-: perh. early (Achaemenian) lw. ← Ir. *raθyā- (in Av. raiθyā-, Pers. rāh, Psht. lār)? (G.M.:cf. EVP 38).
14776 *randati: Gy. eur. rand- 'to scrape, scratch, file, shave'.
14777 ramaṇī-: 1. Kt. (Lentz) řēmař 'poplar', Paš.snj. räimōna. 2. Cf. Ir. Shgh. rīm, Sang. wurmēk 'poplar'.

14781 rāṣṭrakūṭa-: L. P. rāṭh m. 'cruel hard-hearted man' poss. < *rāṣṭr̥- (~ Ved. rā́ṣṭrī-) early replaced byrāṣṭríya- (~ kṣatríya-) 'pretender' MaitrS., 'king'sbrother-in-law (in drama with connotations of rāṭh inL. P.)' Mr̥cch., hyper-Sk. rāṣṭrika- 'governor' Hariv.(J. C. W.).
14782 riṣṭi-¹: for Shgh. riṣṭ (IIFL ii, *6) read rix̌t from raz-, pret. rix̌t 'to fall' (→ Kho. reṣṭ?) G.M.
14783 rucitá-: cf. also as possible source of loan Pers. rušt 'brightly coloured', Shgh. rūšt 'red' (G.M.).
14789 lōbhya-: cf. Psht. lobiyā f. 'a kind of bean' (G.M.).

14791 lōhakāra-: Gy. eur. lovari m. pl. 'tent Gypsies (of SE Europe)'?

14795 vártra-: Wg. Kt. watrwo prob. < Wg. wātr, Kt. wōtr (< *vārtra-) with long vowel shortened beforesuffix -wo (G.M.).
14800 †*vāśuka- 'crowing, calling (of birds)'. [Cf. vāśá- 'roaring' RV., vāśaka- 'croaking, warbling (of birds)'Mr̥cch., Pk. vāsaga- 'making a noise'. — √vāś]
14804 vítasti-: Paš.snj. wiast 'span'; — Paš.lauṛ. wəryahás, wrias, weg. wərəst (see visara-) rather ← a dialect with -r- < -t- ?
14806 vilōḍayati: derivation of N. birolnu, biralnu 'to reject', A. biloliba intr. 'to swing', G. varoḷvũ 'tospoil' from this is supported by vilulita- 'shed (oftear)', saṁlōḍyatē 'is spoilt' MBh.
14807 *vivarati: Gy. eur. briv- 'to comb (wool)', wel. burav- 'to unplait (hair), comb (hair), untwist' DGW iv 48.
14811 śakuná-: cf. also Paš.dar. šuṇaṭā́, ar. šinaṭā́ 'parrot', Shum. šināṭä, Gaw. šiṇaṭo (~ aberrant forms ofśúka-).
14814 śámyā-: Paš.dar. šam-šerík 'connecting piece between ploughshare and beam' BKPD 64.
14823 śrāva-: Ash. Wg. Pr. (Buddruss) c̣ā 'voice, cry, call' (Ash. c̣ā lā- 'to call', Pr. c̣ā li- 'to call out', Wg. c̣ākřõi 'called out' were wrongly analysed s.v. caláyati).
14824 śrīˊ-: M. -s affix to names of relationship rather < svāmin-, cf. use of -bhaṭṭa- with names in śrīmhāla-bh°= mhālasā-bh° in 16th cent. Sk. (J. C. W.).
14825 *śrēṣman-: for B. chep, Or. chepa in view of frequent B. Or. ch- ~ ś- contamination with *cippa- is unlikely.
14826 ślakṣṇá-: Paš. (Leech) "sanna" 'thin', dar. sánɔ-gēn, weg. sanā-gēnī (gēnī) < gavīnīˊ-) rather ← Ind. thanwith IIFL iii 3, 158 < sáṁnata-.
14829 saṁcŕ̥t-: but cf. also Kho. (← Yid.) sanǰ 'floor plank', Ishk. ṣanǰ, Shgh. sānǰ of unknown origin(G.M.).

14831 saṁnaṣṭa-: H. sannāṭā (→ N. sannāṭo) m. 'desolate silence, fearstrickenness' prob. same as sannāṭā m.'loud whistling or whizzing noise' s.v. saṁnādayatiand conn. with san- in the reduplicated formationssansanānā 'to whizz, whistle' (s.v. svaná-) andsansanī f. 'silence, fearstrickenness' with the samerange of meaning (J. C. W.).

14833 sarga-: K. sagun (caus. sagawun, sagᵃrun) 'to irrigate, water, sprinkle water on' rather < MIA. *sagga- pp.to pres. st. sajj- (aor. pass. asarji RV., caus. sarjayati,Pa. sajjēti ~ sr̥játi, °tē 'lets water flow' RV., Pa. sajati'lets loose', Pk. sayaï 'drips, flows') after type bhajjaï~ bhagga-.
14834 sarjayati: for forms in K. see sarga- Add. — Si. sadanavā, ha° prob. < sajjayati.

14835 sāmānya-: Ku. swānī, swāniko der. *swān rather than < *sāmāniya-.

14838 snāna-: Gy. rum. hung. nan-d- 'to bathe' Miklosich Mund viii 22.
14839 snāpáyati: Gy. rum. nayuvav 'I bathe myself', pret. nail'óm Miklosich Mund viii 22.
14841 SRAṀS v.l. śraṁs, but hras- in Av. fraηrasyan- 'name of a subterranean being' (J. C. W.).
14842 haḍḍa-: Gy. eur. hero m. 'bone, thigh' (GWZS 1063) with unexpl. e.
14843 hárati: Paš. ar- 'to accept, agree, hear' rather (like ār- 'to bring') < ā́harati.

14845 *himna-: Sh.gil. hĭn m., gur. koh. hinn f., jij. hĭ̄n 'snow', Sv. hina rather than < sníh- ?
